Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Family”
Reviews.Author: Countrijellybean
Reviews.Content: We stayed this past weekend and they were so nice to us. My son lost his lil Kinz Koala in the room Friday when we went to Disney so when our cleaning lady came by on Saturday morning before we headed out to Universal, I asked her if she found it please put it on the murphy bed he had lost it. She didn't understand much english, BUT when we got back to the hotel that night his Koala was sitting on our freshly made murphy bed, AND she even found my moms sun glasses she lost in the room. We already said that when we go back to Orlando again, we're going to use the same hotel. Thanks to the staff for a great stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Leaving Was The Best Part Of Our Trip!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Carla B
Reviews.Content: If you love sleeping with cockroaches this is the place to go.. No rating I can`t even give it a half star. Mildew curtains, bugs, leaky fridge and bathtub, Fights late at night, never changed our bed sheets I could go on and on but I am sure people will get the picture. They were rude and did not care about anything but their money....

Reviews.Title: “Great location and big rooms”
Reviews.Author: kir569
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great and very affordable. The rooms were large. There was a living room with a pull down bed and kitchen and then a very large room with 2 beds which also had a sink and large mirror. This was great for our family. They had a breakfast that cost a few dollars but we never went because we had our kitchen and made our own breakfast. This hotel is within walking distance to Old Town and Fun Spot. I loved the large size of the room after long days at Disney, Sea World, Discovery Cove etc. The kids could go in their room and we slept on the pull down in the living room which was pretty comfortable. I plan on staying here for our return visits to FL. Its awesome compared to the regular hotel rooms and the price can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “So we killed 3 Cockroaches.....”
Reviews.Author: CityGirl84
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here unless you want to kill cockroaches all night. That is really all I can say about this place, as we changed hotels within 12 hours of checking in. Everything was disgusting. The refrigerator tipped forward when opened. Everything in the kitchen was rusted. Gnats seemed to have made a home in the hood of the stove. The Murphy bed was not securely in place, and my 3 year old nephew thought it was fun to pull it down. Major safety hazard. I have photos AND video to back this up. Not only that, but my brother in law who was a Marine and is now a deputy with a local county's sheriff's office did not feel safe staying there. This is not a 3 star hotel. This is a dump. This is nothing more than 2 story motel....if that. I'm pretty sure if I searched around long enough, I could have bought drugs off of somebody that was just hanging around the hotel and not an actual guest. I suggest if you have this hotel reserved - Get out of it!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Economical & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: electriclady1111
Reviews.Content: Great place for groups. I have allergies, so I bring my own blankets. Otherwise I'm quite satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara L
Reviews.Content: What a dump! The rooms are very outdated and dirty. There are people loitering and groups of guys scanning your cars in the parking lot while you "try" to sleep. It is near impossible to sleep with extremely loud music playing all night long in adjoining rooms. Internet is through a 3rd party company, and is nearly impossible to get it set up. And, be careful...when you make your reservation on line...when you actually get there, they will have extra fees and deposits they will throw at you. One of them being a "resort fee".HA...this is FAR from being a resort...Nothing but drug dealers and construction workers living there! Keep your family away.....!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Birthday get away from Gibsonton”
Reviews.Author: tinkswinkie
Reviews.Content: I planned a weekend surprise get away for my daughter and son, their birthday are both the first week of April. I had ticket's to take them to Medival Times Sunday night. So I wanted a close hotel totake a taxi too so we could all partake of adult beverage. I picked Celebration suits because of all hotel in the area they had the best reviews on tripadvisor. It worked out perfect for us. The staff in the lobby were great getting us checked in quickly with our service dog. I call to find out about a taxi they use. the staff called the taxi service which picked us up in our room. I had ask for a late check out. Since the hotel was not full for that night, they didn't charge me the late check out fee. Thank You. Everything in the room was quit nice. the floors were wood incase the dog had an accident. Yes it's an older hotel but it is well keep up. If I had to complain about any thing it would have been the noise of kids running up and down the hall way. But when you go back into the bedrooms its complete silence. they had sound proofing in the bedrooms. Durning the day Sunday we walked over to the shops across the street. for Dinner we went over to Tony's famous grill (which delivers to the room too) the food was great there as weel. all together this was a perfect place for our little family get away. will go back and stay again when we go back to Orlando. easy to get to disney, sea world everything, its just off International dr. and right off of interstate 4 on highway 192 exit 64. GREAT GET AWAY

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here.....”
Reviews.Author: Autumn1123
Reviews.Content: Ok so, we got here and I was disappointed...it looked dirty from the outside but I wanted to give it a chance. It took forever to check in...when we got to the room there were people loitering around, mostly teenagers and groups of men. The room but was big, but it was dirty I was scared to touch anything, the Murphy bed had a huge yellow stain on it and so I decided to share the sofa bed with my sister which was very uncomfortable. There was dust everywhere....sure it's close to Disney but I definantley didn't feel safe or clean...I had to drug myself with Benadryl to sleep because I was creeped out...you can find a better place

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you ask ALL the questions you have!!! or SURPRISE!”
Reviews.Author: Angela B
Reviews.Content: We made last minute plans and this was all available for our size group. The rooms were clean, although you wouldn't know it from the outside. There were no dishes, no silverware at all. The wireless was an added cost which was a bummer since its FREE at McDonalds and we didn't even pay to sleep there! There was also a cost added for TOWELS! Can you believe that!!! They charged you to use the towels even if you didn't use the pool, which we didn't. Back sliding door didn't lock so well either. I don't like surprises and I certainly don't like surprises I have to pay for. I'll make plans earlier next time so I don't have to settle for less than I expect.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at your own risk!”
Reviews.Author: Kipperz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a band trip to Universal Studios Orlando in March of 2012. Celebration Suites was the absolute nastiest hotel I have ever stayed at. I had read earlier that this hotel had bed bug problems and was very unclean. When we arrived at the hotel we sat our luggage down and turned on the lights, the room looked very dated and had a smell, but it was nothing terrible until i turned the lights off for about five minutes in the bedroom and when i came back in there were bed bugs!!! We collected twelve or more bed bugs. We were moved to a second room which was mistakenly a dirty room with beer bottles and the beds half stripped with pillows everywhere. Our third room we found a cockroach in, however bud bugs were absent. We did not sleep at all. There were a few others in the hotel that we talked to at 12 in the morning between room switching that had seen bed bugs in their room. NEVER will I stay at a "Celebration Suites" hotel EVER AGAIN!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: mjack52
Reviews.Content: we were 3 guys sharing a suite for two weeks of spring training, stayed here last year [also in march] and it was good, but this year we were surprised with new carpet, freshly repainted walls and new mattresses. we could have had a 4th person with still room to spare. the location of the hotel is close to disney and route 4 and is adjacent to old town, which is a great place to visit at nite. my only issue would be the front desk, they are nice all nice people, but all are very, very slow

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa W
Reviews.Content: Space,Space,Space...That about sums it up! Full kitchen(no Oven) but nice and roomy. 2 tvs are great when you have kids.We parked right infront of our room and did't have to lug all our stuff.Staff was GREAT!!

Reviews.Title: “We would stay again”
Reviews.Author: mail4t
Reviews.Content: We got a very good "secret" deal on this hotel - I was wary having been to Old Town and seeing this hotel from the outside, but I was surprised by the inside. It was very clean, the largest room by far we've stayed in the Orlando area. It has a decent sized front livingroom with a sofa, a couple chairs - and my fav part, the Murphy bed. Never had a Murphy bed before. we also had a kitchen complete with range, microwave, dishwasher - we didn't really use anything but the fridge (it was only a 1 night stay), and a decent sized bedroom with 2 comfortable beds - I slept like a baby, a vanity, and a back patio with sliders (I would recommend 2nd fl if u are worried about safety - I liked the first floor, easy access) Positives: LOCATION, I wanted some place we could have activities outside our door - it doesn't get any closer than Celebration Suites - Old town and Fun Spot are literally steps away. My kids enjoyed the pool. I liked the bed and pillow comfort- I enjoyed having a seperate bed for each of my 2 kids, after staying at WDW value resorts the last few times it was nice to have 4 times the space - not to mention a fridge and a microwave. We ate at a decent buffet across the street, but many many options for eat and drink! Also 1.5 mi from Disney - we were there in 10 mins the next am! Negative: Hotel is run down from the outside, some rooms I would be very worried about safety. Satellite cable sucked big time in the bedroom, very fuzzy. I could deal with it for one night, but not for a longer stay. the service at check in was lacking. we stood there for a while before being helped or even acknowledged. Once we were acknowledged I found her rude, then we had to wait in a seperate wait in line for a parking pass. I already want to stay again, so I recommend - esp for the same price!

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely be back next year, or sooner. We loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: GidgetH_12
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived the young man at the desk, tried and succeeded at making our stay the best. We enjoyed ourselves so much, that we stayed an extra day. The room was comfy, clean..... I am already, ready to go back... Great place to stay and bring your kids they will have a blast as well. There is ping pong tables, basketball court, a huge life size chess board, beautiful pools, game room, reasonable rates, and right next to old town, how can you go wrong.... LOVE this place!!

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: Kristin713
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here while visiting Universal Studios. I was immediately disappointed when we were told the shuttle only ran to the park at 10:15am even when it opened at 8:00am and picked up from the park at 6:30. I called before booking and was told that the shuttle ran every 15 minutes or so which is why we booked here. The rooms were a little outdated but definitely clean. The hotel buildings in the back are sketchy...we stayed in a building all the way back and frequently had people roaming around outside in the back parking lot. Perks: the price and having a full kitchen. However, they also charge $10 to rent dishes...rooms accommodate 6-8 and we had place settings for 4 which was a pain since we were a group of 5. The location itself isn't too bad as there are restaurants, gas stations, grocery stores and gift shops nearby. I most likely wouldn't stay again unless I was traveling on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Fab..!!”
Reviews.Author: Cobchris
Reviews.Content: Great place for a base for parks etc, staff very pleasant and helpful rooms a bit dated but very clean over all excellent stay and great value for money, definately stay again..

Reviews.Title: “Great value for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Navarreone
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff was very nice! Went to the front office to ask for hand towels since our bathroom didn't have any. We were given several hand towels, regular towels, and wash cloths. It was nice to have extra!! The maid service was a little off. Like not replacing coffee cups, and not making the kids bed up one day. They brought a lot of stuff animals so maybe they got tired of putting them on the bed. All other days the beds were made nicely, and we liked seeing how the rearranged the animals and our personal blankets. :) The noise from Old Town was unbearable the first night! Which was Saturday. Not as bad on Sunday. I didn't hear it the rest of the trip. Overall the hotel was a nice place with huge rooms for everyone to relax in. I would come back!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Clean, Basic & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: MomaBear82
Reviews.Content: Old Town isn't just a walk away, it butt's up right next to Celebration Suites, so some rooms can be quite noisy. We moved after our first night (with absolutely no arguments, they didn't seem surprised we were asking to move) to one further away from the fair and main road. The rooms are large, although the bathroom is quite small, the master Bed is firm, which is far better than the normal saggy mattresses in most cheap accommodation. Yes, you do have to ask for plates etc when you arrive it's not automatically in the room. The people I booked through, this was included in the price, as was the nightly resort fee. I know some reviews say it's $50 for plates, when we arrived the paperwork said $10.75 including tax. When you book, check if this is included or not. There's no kettle or toaster or oven in the kitchen, just a coffee machine /microwave / dishwasher / 2 ring hob / huge fridge. Wifi is available in the rooms for $12.50 a week - although there was no signal in our first room for it. Celebration Suites is on the main links to all the major attractions and they do have a free bus to most of them, the bus runs once a day to and once a day from each of the main parks. We've not tried it as we have a hire car, but plenty of people were standing at the bus stop so it looks quite well used and reliable. I think the only downside is the large windows at either end of the apartment are fairly well overlooked, so most of the time the curtains are closed. Overall I'm glad we stayed here, it's super cheap, plenty of parking, clean and close to lots of places to go out in the evenings, without the need to drive. Just don't plan any gourmet 4 course meal cook-offs in the kitchen!

Reviews.Title: “hidden fees”
Reviews.Author: jamie r
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few years and this year was my last. After checkout last year I was 2 hours up the road and checked my bill and was overcharged for the the pet fee by 50 dollars...I let it go. This year I was told "59 dollars a night plus tax". At check out on the last day it ended up being and average of over 80 dollars a night by the time they added taxes, pet fee, AND RESORT FEE THAT I WAS NEVER TOLD ABOUT. They have a fee for EVERYTHING...EVEN THE IRON. Staff at check in was nice, the rest of the staff was quite lacking..

Reviews.Title: “Will never go back”
Reviews.Author: smile_u_nut
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a couple times, because the rooms are big and work great for my family, we had little bugs around the stove, I was affraid to have any food sitting out so I put it all in the fridge, with it being so close to old town, it is nice to walk to but you also have to deal with there crowds parking all over the resort makes it very hard to find a parking spot on the weekends and as of late the crowds around old town have been a bit "rough" for me

Reviews.Title: “Fourth stay and never a problem.”
Reviews.Author: Donna W
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling to Orlando for the past 15 years with my 3 children who are now teenagers. For the past four trips, we have stayed at Celebration Suites (formerly Old Town Suites). I considered booking a house this time but my children wanted to stay next to Old Town again. The very simple truth about Celebration Suites is this. It is an older place so don't expect a dishwasher or a five star hotel. We like it because it's familiar and we like returning to the place where we went when our children were little. The biggest problem I've ever had was asking for an additional chair in the sitting area. I've never experienced anything negative. This year for the first time we rented a 2 bedroom suite and I couldn't have been more pleased. Although there were only six of us, we could have slept 12 in the suite! If you need to save a little money like us after paying for Universal Studios tickets, then this hotel may work for you. Once my family and I check in, we are in our own little world. So, our routine never changes. Check in to our room, run to Publix for groceries, visit Old Town the first night and hit the park the next day. Knowing I can save a little money on my hotel accommodations helps a great deal when planning my trips. We're going back in a year and I will stay here again. Hope my review helps.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday 2011 in Kissimmee”
Reviews.Author: Pam C
Reviews.Content: We had booked the room in advance and when we arrived were directed to a room...not renovated, even though I had requested a renovated room, noisy fridge, water in bathroom not great, etc. Called front desk and complained and were given a much better room..still a couple of problems, which the staff offered to move us again, I said no, just send someone to repair the door, light, and phone. Very prompt repairs, and from that moment we had a very good experience at the Celebration suites at Old town. we liked the location and the large suite like rooms are great for longer stays. Not expensive, not fancy, but you get what you pay for; would recommend for travel on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a family”
Reviews.Author: Hz H
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience. Stayed in one of their 4 person suites which included the dishes. Lots of room for a family of 4. We received extra linens when needed. The Murphy bed was very comfortable. The sofa bed mattress was a little thin, but great for an 8 year old. Lots of restaurants and stores right across the street. (Breakfast buffets for $3.99) The room was a little out dated, but it was clean. You can hear the noise from the street sometimes and from Old Town which is next door, but it was very hard to hear the outside noise over 2 air conditioners running. They do charge for somethings other hotels would give you free, but we were in Orlando to go to Universal, not spend time in our room using the wi-fi. They do offer free wi-fi in their business center. We will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of hidden cost”
Reviews.Author: pjennymay
Reviews.Content: Stayed here so many problems on my stay will say the staff was ok but the place was run down noisy even had a fire started in the dumpsters one night lots of people who actaully lived there made it look even more dumpy my biggest problem was all the exta fees I mean you get nothing in this place for free you pay resort fee so call continental breakfeast and wifi even the dishes you need to use the kitchen I would not go back here if you add up all the extras you minus well get a better hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great value but plan ahead”
Reviews.Author: Gu3mom
Reviews.Content: This property is nothing fancy but quite adequate for the price. Be forewarned: the price comes with nothing extra, and I mean NOTHING. You won't find an extra blanket, dishes, flatware, salt/pepper, paper towels, etc, not even a paper plate; no wi-fi in the room. (Everything can be rented, however.) It's still a good place if you know to plan ahead. Parking is decent, location is good; the "fun park" next door is entertaining. To their credit, they provide organic coffee! Having a full kitchen is a nice bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Ruchi S
Reviews.Content: Clean, nice. Good for family vacation specially if you need kitchen. You do need to take your own utensils or else you can rent for $10 a day!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren R
Reviews.Content: The location was awesome! There were plenty of restaurants and gift shops within walking distance. Walgreens is right across the street! The room was large and very clean. The beds are firm, but that is something that is only noticed when you have something else as a preference at home. It was a bit outdated decoratively, but that didnt take away from its functionality. Hotel staff was very pleasant. Have already recommended this hotel to family and friends, and will definietly return.

Reviews.Title: “15 minute stay”
Reviews.Author: RavenGaleano
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to begin. The outside of the hotel pretty much speaks for itself. The rooms were large but very dirty. The table in the kitchen had water stains covering it, as if it hadnt been cleaned since the previous stay. Bathroom floors had scum built up in the corners and the tv had 1/2 an inch of dust around it. No signs of roaches or creepy crawlers but lots of moths found their way in. We found ourselves VERY reluctant to stay so we let staff know. They were extremely understanding and helpful while canceling our reservation. On the plus side, it is in a good location and the pricing was good if you're looking for a cheap place to stay with a few other people.

Reviews.Title: “BIG rooms but extremely old and outdated.”
Reviews.Author: Dcar777
Reviews.Content: Our room was musty. The giant old box type TV's hardly worked. Terrible picture. The cabinets were seperating from the celing. The safe did not work. The towels will physically remove your skin because they are so rough. The floors were sticky. The rooms are huge though. If I were traleling with multiples of people and didn't have a ton of money to spend, I'd buy some Lysol, candles, flip flops, bring my own linens and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected find”
Reviews.Author: wrenvander_11
Reviews.Content: We typically have stayed at Seralago in the past for a lil weekend getaway. This time we did something different and stayed at the Celebration Suites. Overall, I'd have to say this is very much worth a serious look for families looking for an extended stay in the Orlando / Kissimmee area. It is an older hotel- looks like it was probably built in the 1960's. However- the room we stayed in was VERY large- easily 40 or 50% larger than a standard hotel room. It had a small kitchen with a stove, coffee maker, microwave and a full sized refrigerator. The mattress and the linens were actually quite good for a value hotel- we slept like rocks all weekend long. Our room had a full sized bath and GOBS of hot water- which was also very nice. The rooms appear to have been recently refreshed with contemporary furniture and decor- I was not crazy about the buttery yellow walls and ceiling, and the kitchen needs silverware, pots and pans, and a paper towel holder to make it fully useable. Location is great for people going to disney or staying in the Orlando area- it's a stone's throw from Old Towne and Fun Spot and a variety of activities and restaurants for the entire family. I fully recommend that anyone have a serious look at this very value priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal flor the Price”
Reviews.Author: RealFloridaVacations
Reviews.Content: The room was huge at a really low price and it is located within close walking distance of Old Town. There is also lots of dining directly accross the street. The hotel complex is very large. The room was old but fairly well maintained and everything was clean and worked. It lacks the attention that 4 and 5 star hotels have but the rooms are gigantic including a living room, kitchen bath and bedroom. The living room has a hide-a-bed and Murphy, neither of which we used. The internet is the worst ever! It is by a 3rd party contractor so there is a charge, connectivity was awful and when available so slow, dial up would have seemed fast. Do not waste your money on the wi-fi, the hotel should do away with it because it makes them look bad. I will stay there again for the convience of location and the giant room with a kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Celebration Suites, Kissimmee”
Reviews.Author: Rubyshelby
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, but out of date. Close proximity to shopping and to Disney. The gym was not open for use. There was no internet connection available. Had to pay extra for pots, pans, cutlery and dishes. We didn't feel safe.

Reviews.Title: “A DUMP - STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: S C
Reviews.Content: Filthy room, 40 years out of date, noisy because of proximity to Old Town and police cars with screaming sirens arriving on-site to stop fights, etc. Sofa so dirty was afraid to sit on it, extra cost for dishes & cutlery, extra cost for WiFi in room - MUCH better places within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic room, but large and clean”
Reviews.Author: rdopfl
Reviews.Content: It's an old hotel but large and clean. A full kitchen but no plates, utensils or even paper towels. No bed spreads on the beds, Toilet seat was about to fall off. A/C in the bedroom didn't work. Very old TV's. The TV in the bedroom was about 13 inches. No TV guide in the room or even on the TV. Won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “New owner-updated in 2010”
Reviews.Author: bestmaze
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times since 2001ish. New owner and updates really gave this place a facelift. We have also stayed at Disney Value Resorts many times. This hotel shines with families who want more room at a much better price than Disney even if you pay to park your car at Disney parks. We just did a grand tour of Sea World, Busch Gardensand Disney from this hotel. Busch was about an hour away ...EASY drive. Minutes from Disney; 15 from Sea World or Universal. Hotel does have scheduled service to parks but we drive our car for flexabliity. Jan 2011 Celebration pools were warmer than Disney pool...in 2012 Disney slightly warmer. Very apt to have Celebration pool to yourself in Jan. after dark while Disney pools crowded. Grocery and several eating places within walking distance, pizza, Mc Donalds, Italian place, a couple $3.99 breakfast buffets (good), and much more. Always had a clean room but have seen tiny ants (saw them at Disney once as well). Wife and I love bed in living room (folds out of wall) and kids in bedroom..away from us. Have always seen several people behind their large check in desk and it goes MUCH faster than Disney check -in. This hotel is underutilised. Romantic get away...not really place for it. Have several in your party, a vehichle, and do not want to be 'trapped" at Disney? THIS PLACE IS FOR YOU!!

Reviews.Title: “Suits a big group or family.”
Reviews.Author: Vanshadsyd
Reviews.Content: Just remember you get what you paid for. Next door is old town. That greatly makes up for the outdated decor. But the transportation back and forth to the disney parks really leaves something to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: andyco11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from October 28th to November 11th in block D cant remember the room number but it was a ground floor unit with a pool view. The rooms where adequate and clean although the balcony are could have done with a small retaining fence and some chairs and a table so you could sit out whilst smoking. The facilities in the room where good i.e nice big fridge, microwave 2 burner stove top and small kitchen sink, also dining table and four chairs would have being nice if it had a proper oven as microwaving everything isn't very nice. In room safe was big enough to take a full size laptop which was good Staff where always friendly and attentive to your needs nothing was too much trouble for them. Down sides where no free in room wifi you had to pay a small charge to your the wifi in you room and you have to rent all cooking utensils not expensive but still another fee to pay

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Cuteypie39
Reviews.Content: Never again will I stay at this hotel. We traveled far to look for something convient, but got bad service.

Reviews.Title: “Devastation Suites”
Reviews.Author: Michelle W
Reviews.Content: If you are in need of special requests for a stay this is not the place for you. I reserved a room on 10-29-2010 for a stay in 1-2012. On same day of online reservation, I called the hotel and requested a first floor room due to person with disability staying there. When we arrived we were put on second floor and no elevators to be found, we just decided to deal with it. Then the devestation began, that same day we found roaches in our kitchen, Murphy bed didn't have any bedding, bathroom was filthy with a rotten door of peeling paint and entrance door with one inch gap completely around it. Night came and was 34 degrees out side and NO HEAT. Second day came to find a suitecase had been gone through and money was stolen. I had had enough and went to front desk manager to report all to here they are only requests, who uses heat in Florida and well we can move your room on last night.

Reviews.Title: “"Would Definately Recommend It"”
Reviews.Author: Laura O
Reviews.Content: The staff was very good to deal with, very helpful. The room we had was quite close to the office, it was a budget room, but it was perfect!! The room was very clean, we did have a few bugs but nothing to worry about. The pool was nice and close to our room. You do have to bring your own plates, cups, cutlery ( which we did, paper plates...etc ) or you can rent them, which I didn't even check out because i didn't want to do dishes....lol!!! It was a great value for the money and soooo close to everything you need. I would come back and I would recommend it for friends. You really don't spend much time in your room anyways while in Orlando so why pay tons for a hotel room. This room had 2 tv's and a sink and vanity in the bedroom as well, great for families!!!

Reviews.Title: “celecbration”
Reviews.Author: HeatIsOnII
Reviews.Content: Worst ever stay! Suite was musty and the funriture and beds seemed old and musty. The pull out couch mattress had blood stains!!! Had to purchase room deodorizer to just sleep in the suite. Also back glass sliding door was off it.s tracks.

Reviews.Title: “This place is still open?”
Reviews.Author: ChuckieC
Reviews.Content: Hotwire attempted to put my family in this place for one night before our condo week started. We were put across the street in an abandoned looking building where we were the only occupants. The room was straight out of the 50's with horrific furniture and overall filthy conditions. I went back to the desk and they were kind enough to authorize a refund and I made other arrangements for a place in downtown Disney. This property was perhaps the worst I have ever attempted to stay in and as a bass fisherman I have stayed in a few unforgettably bad places! Perhaps the suites on the office side of the street are better, but for my money:Stay away until the place is either upgraded or torn down and if you do stay here, don't get a room across the street!

Reviews.Title: “Look somewhere else!!!”
Reviews.Author: Catedives
Reviews.Content: Old town is actually a dirty street with Ihops and mcdonalds as well as a broken down ferris wheel. It's quite the eyesore. Apart from that the rooms are outdated. The reel problem is that I stayed there in November and was charged the wrong price. After explaining this to the incompetent staff, they assured me that I was wrong and they had charged me the correct price. Now, a month later, I got a 50 dollar charge to my account without any warning at all. The staff, who barely speak English, weren't helpful at all. After passing me along through all the staff on the phone they told me there was nothing they could do. Look somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT go if you have allergies....”
Reviews.Author: Saddleback41
Reviews.Content: Decent place with lots of space BUT if you have ANY allergies DO NOT GO....I do not think they deep clean at all and our daughter became very ill after staying there. Everything was nice but NOT super clean. Mold in corners of bathroom, stale smell in room. Did not say anything as we were only there 2 nights. Be aware if you are using the murphy bed in the living room you can not see the TV from the bed if you like to watch TV in bed. They had a coupon on the internet for a free mug upon check in BUT they had no mugs. Were given the use of the kitchen dishes and pots and pans free(do not know if this was because they had no mugs or not)but did not use the dishes.Not enough coffee or creamers and sugar left by maids(only 1 packet of coffee and 1 sugar and creamer packet). But maid service was good as far as clean towels and beds made. BUT again if anyone has allergies AVOID THIS PLACE I had asked for a deep cleaned room( anyone with an allergy knows this is a must when going to a hotel to avoid asthma/allergy attacks) when I booked the room..Did not get it

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place, friendly staff, and great rooms”
Reviews.Author: mpanawala
Reviews.Content: We loved Celebration Suites and we travel alot! The rooms were huge, super clean and comfortable and convenient to everything. We're pretty discerning and travellers and we would go back to Celebration Suites... The other things people have complained about are pretty normal for hotels close to Disney in Florida, like early check-in fees, etc...

Reviews.Title: “College Budget = Defeated!! (:”
Reviews.Author: AbbyS4
Reviews.Content: A few friends and I went to Orlando recently, and the only reason why we went, was because of this place's prices! The rooms were huge and the service was great! Brian really took care of us! I am definitely coming back!!

Reviews.Title: “Rundown, hidden costs”
Reviews.Author: travelover
Reviews.Content: Things I liked: roominess, price, proximity to shops, restaurants, Disney. Things I didn't like: $20 fee to check in early even though the place was empty, daily fee to use the "free" wifi that was only free in the business center, cold unheated pool, fee for continental breakfast that we assumed was complimentary as it is in most places, $50 fee up front for damages that might happen, urine smell that blew out of the air conditioner, no dishes in the kitchen ( hidden charge for them), tiny bath towels, awful tv reception on old fashioned tv's (no flat screens) But I guess it's what I should have expected for the price and after reading the reviews. We did get a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “quality and space must beat all in Kissimmee”
Reviews.Author: mzungutu37209
Reviews.Content: Staying at Celebration Suites was just like staying at home due to the size of the room and the floor plan. Bedroom is on one side and the living area is separated by the kitchen/dining area which worked great for me Shuttle to the attraction can also save you parking money and having to walk to the huge parking lot. The mattress and pillows (even for the extra bed in the living area) were of high quality like any 5 start hotel which helped me in a good night sleep. For the price, location, and the size of the room specially when I don't like to spend most of my money for hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Garbage”
Reviews.Author: David K
Reviews.Content: Besides just the non stop drip outside all night despite no rain. This was a horrible place to stay and designegned to be deseptively such. I now know why it has almost twenty large buildings of rooms that are all almost entirely empty - horrible quality and service.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Nice”
Reviews.Author: Aisharani
Reviews.Content: Staying at Celebration Suites was just like staying at home due to the size of the room and the floor plan. Bedroom is on one side and the living area is separated by the kitchen/dining area which worked great for me with 2 kids. Shuttle to the attraction can also save you parking money and having to walk to the huge parking lot. Someone mentioned free breakfast, for me it was $1.75 for 3 itmes plus free coffee which I think was an excellent deal. The mattress and pillows (even for the extra bed in the living area) were of high quality like any 5 start hotel which helped me in a good night sleep. For the price, location, and the size of the room specially when I had to spend most of my money at the park, I'd say thumbs up CS.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby (but not Chic), Run Down, Dirty, Bugs”
Reviews.Author: sstrauch
Reviews.Content: This place is pretty run down...we've stayed here several times before in the past and it was bad then but we decided to try it again since they now advertise "Refreshed Room Decor," which is really just painted lamp bases (gold or silver) and maybe new brown carpet. Huge, dead cockroach (palmetto bug) on kitchen floor and ants on counter and stove. Microwave had holes drilled in the top (not a good thing) like it used to be mounted but now sat on the sagging counter and you had to lift up the microwave to open it's door. They charge $10.00 for kitchen utensils - every other hotel with kitchens include utensils. They charge $4.25 for Wi-Fi in your room. Every faucet in the suite leaked badly - also poor water pressure in shower. Long, black hair on bathroom floor behind the door. Staff okay except Sue Pearsall, Reservations Mgr, who was no help at all with overbilling issue - told her to just keep it! Continental Breakfast is $1.75 - limit 3 items and ends at 9:30 AM. Other hotels include free Continiental Breakfast with room. The mattress was good, at least, and the location right next to Old Town. Other than that, would not stay there again. Much better deals for less money. Try the Seralago down the street. Too dirty, dingy and run down!

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for....”
Reviews.Author: Wendurf
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Celebration Suites with my 6yr old son the second weekend in Nov, 2011. The first room I was in was smelly and had a very loud AC. I called the front desk and asked for a new room and they were very accomodating and moved me immediately. The second room was a tiny bit better. Extra costs: $5.30 a day "resort fee" and a $20.00 early check in fee are both stated on expedia and their website. However, $10.70 if you want dishes, utentils and pans. This is not mentioned on either website and if you do not sign a waiver and pay it (and an agreement there is a $100 damage fee) you get nothing. This was not a problem for me, as I went across the street to Publix and got paper products and didn't have to worry about breaking their stuff. The only thing you get is an in room coffee maker with coffee. If you want a toaster or an iron, you have to pay $20.00 to rent them during your stay. Washers and dryers were $2.75 each. Continental breakfast $1.75. Internet $4.25 a day $12.50 a week and $25 a month. The rooms are very dated. Although there are patios and balconies, there are no furniture on them. Moldy shower curtain. Small scratchy towels. Rusty stove/hood/fridge and sink. Will post pictures so you can see. "Free Shuttles" are very limited. They run very limited and were overpacked. The "white DO not cross" line on the bus behind the driver had 5 people standing over that and on the stairs. Most people were either sitting with one or two children on their laps or standing. During my stay, the schedule was as follows: Magic Kingdom left at 8:20am and 12:10pm Returned 7:30pm and 10:50pm Epcot left at 10:25am return 9:40pm Hollywoodstudios left 10:25am return 9:30pm Sea World and Universal 8am return 6pm They do not guarantee seating. If you miss your bus, it is about $30.00 for a taxi. Pros: great location and friendly staff. It is right on the side of Old Town which has stores, restaurants, bars and games.

Reviews.Title: “My first Disney Vacation”
Reviews.Author: angelmedina1
Reviews.Content: My family of 6 stayed in the hotel from Nov 16 to the 23, the room 2233 was very clean and big, there are 2 TV and a full working kitchen. There is a $50 checking in fee that is refunded at check out and a $10 fee for the cooking utensils ( forks, spoons, plates, etc ) I am from Puerto Rico and my English is not very good and was very happy that every person that I met there spoke Spanish and I would have to say that this made my Disney park vacation I lot better and I would visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: volktechster
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very good , Restaurants are all in a walking distance, there are also shuttle buses provided to the outlet mall and Disney world. The free breakfast consist of coffee or Tea, and some packaged juice, a choice of muffin or crackers and a banana. ( no toast or bread, but for the price we paid , can't complain) The rooms are spacious, however there were a few minor problems that we noticed such as the bathroom shower was loose from the wall , water was dripping constantly from the showers and the sink faucet ! the exhaust fan was so noisy like an airplane, and the Air-conditioning unit in the bedroom when running rattles.

Reviews.Title: “great value,great location”
Reviews.Author: cprimo
Reviews.Content: we stayed at celebration suites and it was a great stay,room was cozy,needs a little work but nothing really to complain about,great location,right next to old town and that was cool any time we want to go we were right there.the room was right next to the pool and laundry room and game room so for us and the kids it was a great location,front desk was very helpfull and very nice,been up to orlando tons of times always saw this place,never gave it a shot,very happy that we did,next time we head up celebration will be are hotel we stay at.

Reviews.Title: “walk to the bar”
Reviews.Author: fatmaher
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very large ..taking up a whole block and then some...rooms are a very good price..and if you go to old town bars ...perfect

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: Kyle H
Reviews.Content: I got to the hotel and its really clean and the staff was pretty good, The rooms were amazing, I'm pretty sure I would stay again, but that rate I got had to be special because the rooms are just way too much for what I paid. Really can't believe the rate, rooms are definitely worth a lot more. Big place, nice rooms, I would stay again when I come down.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: kenneth G
Reviews.Content: Absolutely amazing place to stay. We all felt at home straightaway and it had everything we needed. The location was great taking just minutes to get to shops, restaurants and the parks. Everything is spacious and very clean!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap room..but you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: sara t
Reviews.Content: My family of 6 stayed in one of the big suites that was pet friendly and we were NOT impressed. There was hard wood floors which was pretty, but NOT clean! There was huge piles of dust around the edges of the room. The toilet was the only thing nice in the bathroom....rust and broken tile in the tub area. The full kitchen was okay..microwave took forever to heat anything and all the appliances were old and dented/scratched. The TV was fuzzy, not a clear picture. The appearance of the room had peeling paint, broken lights, the bottom of the doors were busted up and there was a huge gap under the main door. The biggest thing was the night club across the street....very loud and annoying. And I found a tick crawling on the floor. I have never had a tick on my dog (a 2lb short haired chihuahua) and I think the hotel should do a better job spraying outside to kill the ticks and fleas in areas where there are going to be alot of dogs. We will not be coming back here and we were happy to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Great price”
Reviews.Author: TRM06
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the beginning of the year so I don't know if things have changed. We looked at the pictures online so we knew that it was more motel than hotel. The lobby seemed updated but that's were it stopped. The lighting in the room wasn't great and it felt dreary. Neither of the A/C units worked properly so it got hot a night. Our room also had an ant issue in the bathroom and the sink in the bedroom. They seemed harmless so we didn't complain. The towels are also way too small and didn't work well to remove the water. The beds were comfortable. The price was great and the location was fantastic. We will probably give this hotel another try in the future, but if it has the same issues, it will be our last visit.

Reviews.Title: “As usual, very pleased with our stay...”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoTripKing
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Celebration Suites / Suites at Old-Town earlier this month for a few days while in town for a mini-vacation. Impressed with the steps they have taken to fix this property up and maintain it - as well as modernize the amenities you expect at your hotel. Staff was quick and polite with the check-in process. Complimentary Celebration Suites mug upon check-in, which was a nice memento from our mini-trip. Good touch as well, to use on the trip and remember their place when you're back home. Room was clean, bed was SUPER comfortable - air worked great, which is a must for any room I stay in. Convenient location as well, with a multitude of food choices within minutes [and some in walking distance] of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place and great location”
Reviews.Author: Carson P
Reviews.Content: Congratulations! For the facilities , hospitality and affection that you provide your costumers. I have spent an awesome couple of days. The Celebration Suites is truly beautiful, comfortable. and the attention of all the staff is excellent. We’ll always come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Destination”
Reviews.Author: Sue C
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to take your family. It's quiet, considering the size, conveniently located, and easy to get to and from pretty much everywhere. The rooms were clean, quiet, and slept up to 8 people. Any problems we had were quickly addressed by the front desk. The towels were a bit skimpy, but we were given plenty of them, AND you can not beat the price!!

Reviews.Title: “great resort”
Reviews.Author: huntursmomanddad
Reviews.Content: great resort. huge so pay attenton when getting driving directions to your room. the cleaning staff were awesome they went aove and beyond.the pool was suposed to be heated but was a little cool . great view of old town from our patio.great distance to drive to disney parks and good laundry services. would recommend this resort to anyone travelling with a large group or a large range of ages( ours ranged from 11-71 so we needed something to suit all of us. having the kitchen was a huge bonus and a publix grocery store right across the street. we didnt use the shuttle as we drove our own vehicle but it is offered free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: jerome347
Reviews.Content: As at Disneyland Paris (see my other reviews) it's always difficult to find a place to stay near Walt Disney World while in business trip because most of the hotels are only for families with kids or not very cheap. Celebration Suites was a pleasant stay (3 nights) for me : close to the airport, free shuttles, free parking and 24-hour front desk. Good value too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stop for a family !”
Reviews.Author: Sandra U
Reviews.Content: I went there with my family (4 kids) during our trip to USA. We appreciated the family room for 6, the free transportation to Walt Disney World and SeaWorld and the kids have enjoyed the pool :)

Reviews.Title: “Big Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: raul m
Reviews.Content: We went to Disney for the first time and I didn't know what to expect from this place for the price We paid I told my wife probably not a good idea staying here but we were surprised!!. The room clean everything was good the room service the best I diddn't have to call to get my room clean every night we came back from the parks everything was clean, new towels and everything in place. I am the one that always stays in a good **** hotel but this place was geat. You should try it !!!

Reviews.Title: “Depressing”
Reviews.Author: TjHubz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in Bldg F on a business trip. When I checked in, I was informed that a $50 deposit was required. That was the first bad sign. When I went to the room, I found the sliding door unlocked. I couldn't put my finger on it for a while but there was something depressing about the room. In an attempt to brighten it up, the whole "suite" was painted in a gloss yellow-gold shade. The ceilings are painted gloss white, In an attempt to make them washable or cover up mildew I guess. The rooms have no art on the walls whatsoever....strange. The carpet and linoleum tile have seen their day, as has the bathroom tile and fixtures. The bedding appeared to be recently new and was very comfortable, but the rest of this property needs a serious overhaul.

Reviews.Title: “Best Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Leah P
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very convenient - it is only minutes away from the Disney parks and has shuttles running throughout the day to all parks and Universal Studios. The rooms are HUGE and can definitely sleep 6 - lots of furniture space to put all your clothes and items in. Has a large kitchen area and that saved us lots of money on breakfast items since we were able to buy frozen/cold items and refrigerate or heat up as needed. I would definitely recommend this to any family or group that needs a place to stay in the Orlando/Disney area. We didn't need to rent a car either b/c of the shuttle service. Lastly - the customer service was amazing. Everytime we called and asked for something, we had it! The renovations at the property are impressive- the fitness center, business center and kids club/playgrounds are brand new and phenomenal. The hotel also has new furniture, carpet and mattresses. Great hotel and a tremendous value. I will definitely come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: julieknfla
Reviews.Content: My family and I stay at Celebration suites every time we visit Disney or Universal (for the last three years) It is always so nice and clean, we appreciate the large suites with all the conveniences of home. It is just a hop, skip and a jump to the theme parks, or you can ride the shuttle.The Grandkids always come with us and especially love visiting Old Town and Funspot, which are just a short walk away. We have watched many new additions to the property, such as the awesome playgrounds the kids enjoy! Also it is evident that many upgrades and repairs to the suites have been and are still taking place. I believe the owners have done an exquisite job in the renovations. The people are always so friendly, and do everything reasonably possible to accomodate thier guests needs. After having several bad experiences with bugs and filth at other hotels in Orlando, we will NEVER stay ANYWHERE ELSE but Celebration Suites. VERY REASONABLY PRICED.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, big suites and very clean for the price!”
Reviews.Author: lorirey1127
Reviews.Content: We went for a weekend, and the place was very lcean, we liked specially the open space in the bedroom and the murphy bed in the living room. the kitchenette was good and was plenty of ice on the facility, so we could easily refill our coolers to take to the parks. Overall, was good, clean sheets and bathrooms, comfy beds and sooo much space in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Celebration Suites keeps getting better with each visit!”
Reviews.Author: jeff1128
Reviews.Content: Took another trip to Orlando this past September and once again stayed at Celebration Suites. The continuing renovations have made Celebration Suites even better. I've been staying at this property for over twenty years and I've never seen it look so good. The new carpeting, furniture, and beds have made the rooms very comfortable. I'm heading back to Celebration Suites this month with some friends and I can't wait for them to see all of the improvements. The management and staff have done an incredible job making my favorite place to stay in the Orlando area even better!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great location”
Reviews.Author: 16371Traveler
Reviews.Content: Wish we would have stayed at Celebration Suites years ago when traveling with our children. Bedroom with balcony, and living room with Murphy bed, each with a TV, separated by a full kitchen and bathroom would have been (and is) wonderful. Nice room, good price, great location. Next to Old Town and the Friday and Saturday night Cruise-ins, walking distance to many shops and restaurants and a short drive to Disney World. Would definitely recommend Celebration Suites!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back again.. Great location”
Reviews.Author: tracykins1961
Reviews.Content: I took My GrandChildren, Son and his wife here on a spur of the moment trip to Old Town. We were Pleasantly suprised by How Nice the hotel was, The Room was Plenty big enough for the 5 of us and even though it said it accomidated 6 you could sleep 8 peopl. There was a full size refridgerator, a microwave, dishwaser and even a 2 burner type stove. We will definatly be back for a longer stay in the future as we try and take the kids on fun little trips through out the year, This is a great place for familys a lot to do on property. Now for the not so Good be prepared to leave a 50.00 deposit at check in, You will get this back barring there is not issue with room. That was the only suprise when they asked for my Credit card to charge this on and said in a week or 2 it would be revesed. ( i left cash instead). All in all this is a great palce with a great location to the area attractions

Reviews.Title: “Nice Florida Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Longhorns2011
Reviews.Content: My husband decided to surprise me on my birthday to go to Disney. I had never been to Florida and know how expensive a trip can be. He found a place called the Celebration Suites. This place looks very expensive online but we found rates are very reasonable. Not to mention they have a shuttle service so we did not have to purchase a rental car. The rooms are very clean and the staff is very sweet and helpful . They recommended a few restaurants around the area that the shuttle could take us too. I hope to stay here again if we get a chance to come back to Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Get more bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: Sameer K
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Celebration Suites at Old Town while attending a conference at the Orange County Convention Center. The hotel was a bargain and was so close to Old Town that you could literally just walk over to the nearby bars and restaurants. The hotel was just 10-15 minutes drive to the Convention Center so the location worked out very well. The suites are very spacious and allow large families up to 6 to fit in one room. Overall the hotel was very clean, safe, and the management was very good. If you really want a bargain hotel with plenty to do within the hotel and nearby this is the place to go. I would definitely go back with my family in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Updates were the least of it....”
Reviews.Author: Loretta F
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Celebration Suites several years back with our three children. Though the hotel was in need of updating, we enjoyed the stay. As a couple we again stayed at Celebration Suites in 2009 and were greatly disappointed. The rooms did not appear to have been updated since our first visit (about 9 years ago), the tiles and fixtures appeared to have been repaired (shably). This time we were OK with the visit. However, we were directed to the lobby conceirge to purchase Universal Studios tickets. My husband was instructed to go to the hotel next door to complete the transaction because the person at the desk was not there. Upon purchase he noted that he paid for two tickets but the receipt only read one ticket. The woman at the counter assured him this was typical. When we reached the gates of Universal we had to purchase another ticket because the gate attendant could only go by what the receipt read. Upon return to Celebration Suites we were again instructed to go the the hotel next door. We waited for hours to try and get the situation straightend out. In the end, we were told they would check into it and refund the money to our credit card, as we had proof that our card was charged for two tickets. Two years later, we have not heard from anyone about the trouble this caused and no refund. Even if this is a separate company from Celebration Suites, it is their responsibility to assure their guests are treated fairly or to remove the company representative from their property. Our last trip to Fl was a family trip. We stayed on-site at Universal at a much higher rate, but we are not eager to take another chance on Celebration Suites to complicate our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort near Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Cordial1
Reviews.Content: Enjoyable place away from maddening rush of Disney, but close enough to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Affordable and Huge”
Reviews.Author: CP B
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic. It is convenient to everything and quite inexpensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “What a make over!”
Reviews.Author: russell o
Reviews.Content: Our church youth group has been staying at Celebration Suites for the past nine years as we participate in Rock the Universe weekend at Universal Studios. The price and accomodations cannot be beat. Having five youth and a chaperone in one room at the prices they charged helps alot. Plus being able to have breakfast in the rooms with the stove and full size refrigerator. Two weeks ago when I walked in the rooms, whoa!!, new carpet, new sofas, painted inside and out. I was impressed. We reported a problem with an A/C in one of the rooms and the maintenance guy was there within 15 minutes! As long as we go to Rock the Universe, we will be staying at Celebration Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Disney and Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Cris C
Reviews.Content: This place is great for a weekend at Disney. We had a blast and the staff was really nice. The location is very convenient to everything and that was important to us because we had heard that you could spend a lot of time in traffic if you were not careful where you stayed. We had also heard that the closer you were to Disney the more expensive everything was. This hotel is very close and very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: TeresaMust
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and affordable. The rooms were large, the AC was cold, the grounds were well maintained and the staff was friendly. This hotel is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Celebration Suites "Where Nightmares Come True"”
Reviews.Author: L S
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be close to Walt Disney World the day before we were to check into the resort, so we decided to stay here after a long drive to Florida. When we pulled in the first thing we saw was a broken roof on the drive thru area in front of the lobby. Check-in took 45 minutes. The line was backed up all the way outside. They did not have our pack and play we'd asked for and acted like it would be a big deal for us to get one, so we decided to just forget about it and ended up having to have our newborn sleep in the bed with us. When we got to the room it was FILTHY! I had to use anti-bacterial wipes on EVERYTHING before I'd even let me kids come into the room. The kitchen table was so dirty that the wipe was BLACK after cleaning the table and chairs! The beds were dirty. The floor wasn't clean. It smelled of smoke and mold. There was mold in the closet. There weren't enough linnens and pillows for a family to stay there. The staff wasn't helpful. There wasn't a phone book in the room so were weren't even able to call a local food place to have food delivered. I will NEVER stay here again and will be sure to tell EVERYONE I know not to stay there either! AWFUL!! AWFUL!! AWFUL!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: nipiotrowska
Reviews.Content: I definitely have mixed feelings about this property. Unfortunately it was not what I expected, this is a motel. I traveled in a group of six and this was the only place that could accommodate so many individuals in one room for an extremely low price. The room itself indeed, was clean but outdated as well as the bathroom, and the showerhead and faucets had no water pressure. I would not stay here for any longer than the one night that we did. This is an O.k. pit stop if traveling through for one night or need something budget friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Jai B
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was amazing! The staff were very friendly and easy to get along with. The room was kept in a clean state and was very spacious. We had fun at Universal Studios too! all round good place to stay

Reviews.Title: “This is MOTEL not a HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: ronsietheexplorer
Reviews.Content: Our family arrived at Celebration Suites expecting to be at a hotel. At first we were not very happy with the property standards, but after sometime we came to like it. As far as motels go Celebration Suites is pretty well known in the city of Kissimmee as a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff and great accomadations ,cant wait to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: carol c
Reviews.Content: the staff was friendly and helpful.We loved the closeness to old town and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Carol B
Reviews.Content: Our family has stayed at this older hotel many times because you have a suite. With a teenager, the second living and sleeping area with it's own air conditioning and television is a definate bonus. The new owners are working to upgrade the rooms in this large facility. New mattresses are a definate welcome compared to the prior ones - much more comfortable. The spacious rooms are appreciated - you actually have room to turn around here. The bathrooms need attention to detail - clean fresh caulk etc goes a long way to make the area look nicer. The drawback to the bathroom is the towels - small and thin. If they upgrade the solid flooring in the bathroom and the kitchen area to a newer style, it would keep it from looking dated. We only live 2 hours away but prefer to stay here when we come to Disney or just go out to eat. It may be an older facility, but it is solid and the employees are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine”
Reviews.Author: happycat795
Reviews.Content: Now let's get things straight - it's not the Sheraton - you get what you pay for but what you get is absolutely fine. I too read reviews before travelling with my husband and daughter and were slightly concerned of what we would find. My husband got up to the room first and stated "I don't know what they're celebrating" but it took us no time to settle in and in all honesty there is nothing wrong with this place. OK the tv showed grainy at times, the fridge makes this bang noise intermittently ?! and the dishwasher doesn't do it's best which was the only thing that wasn't sorted after the repair guy came. However the staff are all lovely. Always answered calls promptly, always helpful and as in life things need fixing, maintenance came in around 5 mins and the beds and pillows are truly comfy. One night we forgot the car window down and found it in the morning just as we left it. in fact the only reason I haven't given a rate of 5 is we did not have a carpeted room - only lino which I don't recall seeing in their pictures (I could be wrong) and housekeeping do need to give the floor a good sweep/wipe. There also was not a single picture hung in the suite anywhere which would have been nice and I've seen a mirror on walls by the kitchen in photos by others, again we didn't have that which would have been useful. A good point to remember though some things are not their fault. Paid for internet which properly mucked us about for first few days but spoke to/complained to outside company and lady took it onboard and did sort it out. Also last time I used laundry only 1 out of 6 maybe 8 washers worked so had to go to block further away. The helpful repairer guy from the outside company was working on those washers. Mentioned those to him and before I went to dry my loads I passed the first laundry and saw all the machine displays showing properly. So in a nutshell this place is....."absolutely fine".

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family”
Reviews.Author: gloverami
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our 5 kids, for 11 days, in June. We loved the size. Everyone had their own space. We could hang out in the living room and watch t.v. comfortably. It was very nice to have a kitchen. Everything was clean and comfy. Kids LOVED the Murphy bed. Laundry and pool area is nice and easy to get to. Loved where the hotel is located. It's so close to the restaurants and Disney. Did have a few plumbing issues, but they were taken care of. It was a very nice experience and we were all sad when it was time to go!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Arsala A
Reviews.Content: In the beginning I thought it would be as mundane as the ones I have seen in my past. How ever the service and the room that was provided was above my expectations. The suite was very spacious for the price, the kids loved the game room and the ping ping tables. We'll definitely be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “I've sent so many friends there who now also LOVE IT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: johele
Reviews.Content: I don't just speak for me, we're going back this time 9 of us, and this time...never mind Disney or Universal; we're only going to ENJOY and have fun on site!!!! there is absolutly no place like Celebration suites for the perfect family vacation! But if you read those who complain, they must be the type who want the luxury high price upscale hotel but they can't affort it so they're just good to complain !!!The double bed room with its own air conditionning and the living with the murphy bed has its own, not everybody likes the same temperature so this is a big + Everything there is great with all ages family members! I JUST LOVE IT

Reviews.Title: “Cheaper Not Always Better”
Reviews.Author: Angela1228
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was okay for the price paid. We had a roach problem with our first room and was quickly moved to another room. The rooms are not updated but again you get what you pay for. I didnt like that fact that in order to use the internet in your room you had to pay. Not many hotels make you pay for WIFI services. The hotel is in a good location for Old Town. I don't think the maids do a very good job at cleaning b/c there was dirt all in the corners and hairs. To me if they would clean the rooms as good as they cleaned the lobby everything would look great besides the outdated furniture & TV's. To me the shuttle service was the worst part of the stay. The driver would rope off seats with an extension cord so that no one could sit in those seats. However once everyone was loaded up and standing we would go to the next hotel and he would give them the seats. Same thing in the evening when getting picked up he would call out the name of some Villa place and they would get on the bus first so they were guaranteed seats. The shuttle buses didnt use their air it was hot and miserable. At one point the bus driver took one of the passengers cameras and was taking pictures for her while he was driving putting all of his riders in danger. By the way he had a nasty attitude. The buses sounded like they were going to break down everytime we rode them. I really think the hotel should check into using other shuttle services.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!!”
Reviews.Author: SMV_11
Reviews.Content: My family went on vacation to Old Town recently and we all had a wonderful time at the Celebration Suites! We enjoyed our stay with the kids and had a blast at their pool. The hotel décor looked newly renovated, our suite was very clean and the staff was very friendly/helpful as well. Being out and about all day, it was a great plus to not worry about parking when we got back in the evenings. The room would always be clean when we returned and the beds were incredibly comfortable! This was a really nice place to stay and was perfect since its convenient location was close to all of Orlando’s attractions. Old Town was amazing and for the price we paid, we got a Whole lot more than we expected!

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING!!!! This place is HORRIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica A
Reviews.Content: DISGUSTING!!!! This place is HORRIBLE! We paid $80 per night for this dump. After check-in which for some reason took an hour, we walked into a room that had crumbled up food and crackers on the floor and old food pieces on the table. The cockroaches and ants were everywhere, the toilet seat was broken, shower was leaking, the appliances were older than I am, kitchen cabinets were rotting, the beds were made but the sheets were stained yellow, the carpet was wet, kitchen floors were dirty, and too much more to even name. And if you complain and so are forced to deal with Joe the manager, brace yourself because he is the most vile, rude, and arrogant hotel manager you will ever meet. He met me in the lobby where he shook my hand and put his arm around me and pulled me way too close. I began to explain everything thinking he would be outraged that this could have happened but instead he pulled me outside where he got in my face and yelled at me and said I "could take my bags and go" because he'll get the room booked out right after me anyway. When I told him that I found the room conditions unacceptable, he got in my face and said condesendingly, "Yeah, I know how to run a hotel, okay?" This man was creepy, loud, he wouldn't let me get a word in each time yelling at me for everything I said, and he even said that because its peak season sometimes they just don't get around to getting all the rooms cleaned in time. His attempt to fixing this was sending a maintenance guy to our room with a vacuum cleaner who handed us sheets for us to change, and saying that the toilet seat could not be fixed bc they don't have another. We stayed only the 1 awful night because it was already midnight at this point and we had 3 kids with us, but we ran out of there the next day and went to Hawthorne Suites instead which, for the same price, provided a totally different experience. I cannot imagine, even with the lowest of standards, that anyone would be satisfied with this place. This place is only suitable for the cockroaches that reside in it.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay again!”
Reviews.Author: GOJOtravels
Reviews.Content: From the moment, I saw the exterior of Celebration suites, I felt disappointed. It looked very old. However, the rooms did look a lot better. At first glance, decent room with old kitchen appliances. However, I was very disappointed with the King Master bed, the mattress was stained, and the mattress cover had to be replaced (very hairy). I'm grateful for lysol. Here's the pros and the cons for you to decide: Pros: Large Master bedroom Murphy Bed Full size refrigerator shuttle ride(but very limited) Cons: Filthy mattress: don't know what you will get Leaky Shower(old) Constant Trips to the office to get Keys to use the amenities(made me feel like I was in prison or something) Too much hair in bathroom Very Limited Shuttle rides to parks (may not be beneficial)i.e. One drop off and one pick up All in all, I could not wait to return home. For the price, you could definitely go elsewhere for a more pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Only Suites to stay at in Kissimmee! PERIOD!”
Reviews.Author: buffyville
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough about this hotel. First off the space you get for the money is amazing. I have not been able to find a better value in Kissimmee, and frankly wouldnt want to, because im sure i would not get the treatment that ive recieved here. From the time you make your reservation, to the time you check out, you are treated like family. I remember the last time i went on my birthday, i wanted to bring my chihuahua (cant imagine a birthday without her), and had questions, concerns etc, the person on the phone took the time to explain all and did not rush me one bit. They also have Wi Fi in your room (for a VERY small fee). Disney Minutes away, Old town next door..many great restaurants right down the street like Macaroni Grill, Uno's pizza, chillies and more. I recommend this place to all my family and friends!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Great value and location plus attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: Zaff_T
Reviews.Content: Came to Orlando with the extended family- parents, grandparents and two kids. The hotel was very spacious and the kitchen/dining room were a godsend. We loaded up on groceries from the Publix across the street and made ourselves breakfast every day for a week savings us bundles of money. We took advantage of the free park shuttles and the business center. Kids loved being next to OldTown and spent all their free time there enjoying the amusement rides. The Sling Shot reverse bungee was amazing and the hotel offered an exclusive discount for it otherwise it was quite expensive. Parents enjoyed the bars and restaurants at Old Town- Flippers Pizza and Tex Mex are outstanding! Beds were comfortable and the rooms clean- we needed a few extra towels and they were promptly delivered. All in all we had a great experience- the hotel definitely exceeded our expectations and saved us lots of money. I would highly recommend it for families. If you're in Orlando on business and have an expense account, it doesn't make as much sense, but for large families, I can't imagine a more ideal hotel or location.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Room....Will not be back!!”
Reviews.Author: saintsmomx2
Reviews.Content: First let me say I am very dissapointed about this hotel. Everything I researched online said it was great, minus a few bad reviews. Got to our hotel late on Saturday night. Checked in and unloaded our belongings. Went into the kitchen and spoted food and crumps under the table. Also our mirror in the bathroom was not clean. There was dried sugar on the countertop and a dead bug in 1 of the cabinets. I looked at the murphy bed that you could pull down in the living room area and took pics of what I could not believe the dirt and filth. The kitchen smells like mildew and mold. I told the front desk about our room on Saturday night and they said they could move us. With so much stuff that we had and had already unpacked (it was already 3am), I told them we would stay in this room and please have someone come clean it in the morning. Was getting ready to leave for the theme parks and the maid came in. Told her to come back in 1 hour and we would be gone. Got back to the hotel that night around 11pm and our room was not cleaned at all. Called the front desk and told them of this. They did come and empty out the trash and that was it. We were in our room for 2 days before someone came and cleaned it. Food under the table still there for 2 days. I let the front desk know and the Director of Operations said they would take a look at my bill and adjust it. Needless to say our bill was already paid for and they couldn't do anything about it but to give us a free night in the future. Don't worry, I will not, never ever return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved iiitttt!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Deemiami24
Reviews.Content: We had a great time... The hotel staff are very helpful and the rooms are super clean... Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great place & Location”
Reviews.Author: lisakay01
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed here for a week and really liked the place! The room was very clean, the beds had clean sheets and very comfy, Room was somewhat updated with newer couch, tables, and carpeting in livingroom , TV's are very outdated, need to update We did have a problem with the bathtub and toliet clogging up but was fixed very quickly. The location is also nice with plenty to see and do, right next door to OldTown that has alot going on. Would definately recommend to all! and will be our place of stay next year.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas In Orlando - we made it work...”
Reviews.Author: mdegracia
Reviews.Content: It was ok. The first room we were taken to was really bad. It was midnight, and we had been flying from the west coast all day. We unloaded the car in the pouring rain, and the suite smelled strongly like disinfectant. When we made the reservations online, the pictures we had seen looked NOTHING like that! I called the front desk, and within the hour, we had a newer room. Mind you, these are NOT upscale suites. But, if you want lots of room, and a kitchen, it is ok. The shower did not work, so we took baths. We reserved dishes, and there were none - so they scraped enough together for us. The TV's quit working a couple of times, and only had a couple of channels that worked- and there was a loud background hum. The fridge was loud, we closed the door to the kitchenette, so we could sleep at night. Laundry facilities are very inconveniently located. We went to the WalMart and got a small Christmas tree with lights, and stocked the fridge with necessities. We enjoyed the magic of the 10 days we were there. in spite of our disappointment in the room. We felt safe enough. Location was central. The manager was incredible! He helped us as much as he could. We got him a box of chocolates for his efforts. Would we stay there again? Perhaps, but only if the price was lower, and we had a choice of one of the remodeled suites.

Reviews.Title: “Will NOT select this site again!”
Reviews.Author: janeq528mg662
Reviews.Content: Beware at checkout that you are not charged for a 'hole-in-the-wall' that is there when you check-into the room! More than one person being charged for something they DID NOT do! Even if you do not use the pull-down bed, check behind it and tell desk of anything out of order.

Reviews.Title: “I defiantly Recommend Celebration Suites”
Reviews.Author: rptrinity
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean,sheets were white as snow . Very comfortable overall.For a budget hotel I defiantly recommend.the front desk personell was courteous.Housekeeping took care of our rooms and with a tip left extra towels and blankets.The floors were clean.I really saw no problem at this hotel other than the tv worked only on 1 station and was outdated.

Reviews.Title: “coment”
