Reviews.Author: malenny
Reviews.Content: My family loves this hotel when we visited Orlando we always stay in these suites because they are very comfortable, clean and friendly employees.

Reviews.Title: “resort fees? with roaches”
Reviews.Author: hrivera72
Reviews.Content: I went to there to see what was new and I regret it, They now charge resort fees..why? this is no damn resort, they have nothing they offer for free, my room did not even get serviced and I was there two days. There was roaches in the room, the curtains had rips and were duct tape and they said, "79 dollars a night because it is a master suite, its a new one.." yeah right! it was as old as it was before except now they have resort fees... I would never stay there again. I rather rent two rooms across the street at the Motel 6, it is clean and they clean my room everyday and its less than 40 bucs for two beds. I was really disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible & Unsafe”
Reviews.Author: WorkingWomanCFL
Reviews.Content: Girls traveling alone should not stay this property. It was dirty, scary and unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Notting much... except noise!”
Reviews.Author: SweetClementine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Celebrations Suites for a week. Pros : - size of the room - kitchen / fridge and a Publix supermarket near - bed are comfortable - really old but clean enough... - pool are ok - cost! Cons: - free shuttle for Disney only 2 time a day and the hours are bad... ex: the return is at 10pm, so not late enough to be able to see the shows, fireworks and parade at Magic Kingdom. Shuttle is packed and it's long... - bedroom TV didnt work and even after 3 complains... nothing was done - poor staff - poor breakfast... you can't even call it a breakfast... coffee was terrible, nothing hot, only snackbars and greasy muffin... no fruits, no milk, no toast... - but the worst of all... THE NOISE! you can ear everything! The other room shower, toilet.... - internet is of charge, 15$ a week Overall, not such a nice stay, but it's a big cheap basic room! If you have a car, a big family and your deaf... go for it...!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, can't complain at all”
Reviews.Author: amarilisamador
Reviews.Content: Well, we went around looking for a hotel with a kitchen at an affordable price and we came upon this one. It was very good, clean and close to Disney. For the price, couldn't have asked for a better hotel. Even though it's a bit outdated, it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special here”
Reviews.Author: TheCleaningLady1972
Reviews.Content: We traveled with extended family and chose Celebration Suites because of the price and nothing more. Where to begin? For starters, I read the reviews on this place before our trip so I knew what to bring...ie, pots, pans, dishes etc. Unfortunately we only cooked in the suite 1 time...reason being - we made breakfast the first morning we were there, and then left to go to the race at Daytona. When we returned, I realized that although we had turned the stove knobs to off, the stove was indeed still on and a pan of bacon grease was on one of those burners !! We ended up turning it off at the breaker to ensure that it was really off. We reported this to the front desk twice and I'm pretty sure no one bothered to make a note of this. Room 1371 for managements information. It was only dumb luck that the place did not catch fire. The knobs on the stove were not original to the stove and were actually from an oven. We realized this because they had a broil setting on them. Our opinion was that this was probably not an intelligent idea on that part of the staff to replace the knobs with ones that did not fit properly, and as a matter of fact a hotel had burned down just up the street the week prior. As for the cleaning, pretty much non-existant. Sure they will bring you clean towels and change the garbage bags - most days - but the vaccumming is never done and the floors are never swept or mopped. When we asked for our room to be cleaned, the maid told us she did not speak english. We found some bugs in the room, but we expected that considering we were in the south. We paid for an "updated room" but the updates went as far as new paint on the wall and a new carpet. Old furnature, a broken couch, faulty stove and chairs with rips and stains on them is what we got. Also the fridges in both unit we rented froze everything we put in them. The grounds were very poorly maintained with trash on the ground all over. The security is on duty all the time as there are a lot of undesirables in the area. Most of the nightly problems seem to stem from people that are not even guests of the hotel but local kids that wander aimlessly at all hours of the night and day. For the money we spent and the time that we were actually there, it was so-so. Nothing special thats for sure. A decent place to shower and sleep and that's about it. The hotel was conviently located on the strip and having Old Town next door was nice. The rooms are spacious for a family but far from clean so plan on doing your own cleaning. Personally I think the hotel should: #1 - put up fences around the "resort" and # 2 - fire the maid service supervisor who is definitely not teaching her staff the proper way to clean a room. Pool area was unclean with garbage and dirty towels left on the deck. With the amount of people that we always in the pool we found it better to not use the pool. One good thing is that the air conditioners worked very well in the room. Price was the only good thing about this place. Definitely would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and a Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Maricarmen20
Reviews.Content: My family and I went for vacations on this hotel and we found it very nice, they can improve the living room's TV and the kitchen's chairs though. The bedroom tv was a nice, little lcd but the living room's tv had some problems (lines going up and down like for the 4th time of use) and the seat on the kitchen table's chair were not that great, I thought they were going to break. If you're going to use the internet, you have to go to the business center or near to get free signal, using their computer cost .50 per minute (man! those minutes seem like seconds...so it's better to use your own computer!) Some times you just can't have parking near your room because there's people from Old Town that are not staying at the hotel using the hotel's parking. The beds are incredibly CONFORTABLE!!! I'm loving the new matresses!! :D Can't really talk about the pools, unffortunately couldn't use them, we had no time, but they looked nice. As an overall, it's a nice place to stay, plus the people on front desk are really, really nice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and the closest hotel to Old Town”
Reviews.Author: kathy4172
Reviews.Content: My son was home from Afghanistan and we decided to spend an evening @Old Town. Didn't want to have to drive so we chose Celebration Suites. Clean suite and friendly staff. Also want to thank GM Brain Wong. Very generous of you Mr. Wong for what you did for my son. We will return on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Improvements make Celebration Suites even better!!”
Reviews.Author: jeff1128
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Celebration Suites (formerly the Days Suites and the Suites at Old Town) since the early 1990s. The improvements made by the new management are fantastic! They have turned what was very good hotel into an outstanding one. The new mattresses have made the beds amazingly comfortable. The staff is very friendly and helpful; customer service is now a priority. The new furniture and décor look great. I recently recommended the Celebration Suites to a friend, who was looking for accommodations in the Orlando area. After his stay, my friend told me that he will never consider staying anywhere else in Orlando. The combination of spacious, comfortable rooms, excellent customer service, and a convenient location to all of Orlando’s attractions make the Celebration Suites the best choice for accommodations in the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “we'll be back it was great”
Reviews.Author: EEvans33
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 6, 2 adults 4 kids. The 1 bed we were given was very spacious and clean, we were located facing the pool which was great. The staff were lovely and really helpful. Very close to everything you would need, free shuttles to all parks which was really good for us. we stayed for 3 weeks and will be booking again for next year.

Reviews.Title: “The mangerment here dont care about the guests.....other guests were disturbing the peace at the pool n he said he didn't care!!”
Reviews.Author: Mookie8
Reviews.Content: I will never return again because it's suppose to b newly renavated but it's not!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever seen”
Reviews.Author: kjmomof6
Reviews.Content: We stayed here of may 2001..It was the worst place ever..The room was dirty, old food on the floor,blood on the bathroom door and floor,staples falling out of the chair in the living room and the smell was so bad it made my daughter sick..it was 11 at night when we arrived to our room after a day at disney and had it not been so late I would have packed my children up and left immediately. We went to the front desk in the morning the manager was rude ..They charged us 149 for 1 night..I then went to the disney all star resort and stayed there for 118. I didn't have to worry about roaches or the gangs fighting outside my hotel door, or what nasty stuff was in my room..The night we stayed here i slept on my clothes with my shoes on in case we had to get out fast..I contacted them at their email as they ask you to, they told me to give them a few days and they would get back to me....It's been a month and i'm still waiting for a response. I posted on their facebook page telling them i would gladly post photos of out room and they removed me from their page..

Reviews.Title: “THEY ARE CROOKS!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: motorheadjp
Reviews.Content: worst place ever...never will stay there again paid for room in cash a month later they charge my credit card...room wasnt nice enough to be charged twice...always get run around!!!! they screwed up and dont fix their mistakes and screw up my account! i think they need to dobackground checks they pocket your cash payment and then charge your credit card....check your cameras...duh!!!!! we are professionals..we own our own business a stealing employee would be fired on the spot, were not a charity cant afford to just give our money away...please do not give your credit card info...they will charge you a month after your stay!!!! horrible people!!!! nasty rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: kp0103
Reviews.Content: First of all, I did read the reviews before going, and knowing that we paid very little for this hotel for the week, I went with an open mind. I was pleasantly surprised. The room was clean and big. The king size bed was really comfortable. There were four of us, two adults, two teenagers. You can't beat the location!!! We absolutely loved being so close to the Slingshot and the rest of Old Town. We had a fabulous time every single night walking around Old Town, watching the crazy people on the Slingshot and the Sky Flyer or whatever that insane thing is called LOL By the end of the week, I was actually brave enough to try the Slingshot and it was amazing! Anyway, back to the hotel. We stayed on the second floor of Building H. It was fine, but we did find it a little far to walk to the Business Centre every night to check email. Yes, I realize we were on vacation and didn't necessarily need to check email every night, but for us, this was a source of comfort in a very difficult situation we were going through. Other than that, we have nothing to complain about. We were a little surprised that on the second day, we found out that we could've had dishes in the suite for $10 for the week and that the rental for the toaster, etc was extra. By the time we found out about the dishes, we had already bought paper plates and plastic utensils. We'll know next time. All in all, mostly due to the location, we absolutely look forward to staying there again. We have no real complaints, no bugs, nothing missing from the room, etc. Old Town is awesome! For the price we paid, we got a whole lot more than expected!!

Reviews.Title: “It was what we needed.”
Reviews.Author: jlpiland
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Celebration Suites on several occasions before, so knew what they had. We had a one bedroom suite that slept six - it was perfect. We had three adults and three children. We have stayed there before in a two bedroom suite. You could not ask for anything any better. The location is great and the staff is professional. I recommend this motel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: danjiffm
Reviews.Content: We have been going to this hotel for 20 years, we will never be back. Where do I start? The refrigerator was broke and never replaced. The cleaning staff left the room open when we were out and I had things taken from my room. I asked for a cleaner room and was told no. Receptacle covers were off leaving wires exposed. The toilet had feces all over the toilet and it was never cleaned. We cleaned it ourselves. We had to purchase our own toilet paper since we would not allow them back in our room after being left open. We had to go to the front to get towels. I could go on but I think enough is said.

Reviews.Title: “The worst place I've ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: wareagle2259
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not at all like the website advertises! It is old, very outdated, and the wall paper was falling down. The refrigerator leaked and it was very trashy looking on the outside. No one ever picked the grounds up. All I can say about this place is the bed was pretty comfortable after we went to Wal-Mart and bought new comforters to sleep under. DO NOT STAY AT THIS PLACE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great families & love the price!”
Reviews.Author: RCSoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Celebration Suites for a week while visiting Disney and were blown away by the size of the suites for the price we paid! Rooms were simple, but very nice and clean. Great pool and one night there was live music by the pool! Location is great - close to restaurants, parks, etc. They've just built a "Kid's Play/Movie Room" which my kids were dying to go to, but it wasn't ready yet. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: shawnaferd
Reviews.Content: To start our nightmare vacation.....There were roaches in our room,the stove would not cut off (when we called the front desk for this issue it took maint. over 1 1/2 hours to come look at it.),after looking at it they cut it off at the breaker box and said they would return in the morning to replace it. They never showed. So we had to keep cutting it off at the box ALL week.,the water main busted (no water usage),My husband had bought an 18 pack of beer and somehow while we were at one of the parks 14 of them vanished.,oh and while there a local business was robbed.

Reviews.Title: “Stress Free!”
Reviews.Author: madnimursil
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very convenient - it is only minutes away from the Disney parks and has shuttles running throughout the day to all parks and Universal Studios. The rooms are HUGE and can definitely sleep 6 - lots of furniture space to put all your clothes and items in. Has a large kitchen area and that saved us lots of money on breakfast items since we were able to buy frozen/cold items and refrigerate or heat up as needed. I would definitely recommend this to any family or group that needs a place to stay in the Orlando/Disney area. We didn't need to rent a car either b/c of the shuttle service. Lastly - the customer service was amazing. Everytime we called and asked for something, we had it! The renovations at the property are impressive- the fitness center, business center and kids club/playgrounds are brand new and phenomenal. The hotel also has new furniture, carpet and mattresses. Great hotel and a tremendous value. I will definitely come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “avoid at all cost worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: gss200881
Reviews.Content: the rooms where so dirty didnt even wanna take my shoes off beds horrible tv didnt work bath tub gross a bar in the alley way with drunks and drugies also seems to be people that actually live in these hotel rooms and I mean scetchy people avoid at all cost there are so many hotels right around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great sized suites and comfortable beds - great value”
Reviews.Author: Fowlerinfife
Reviews.Content: The rooms are basic but huge and clean. If you asked for the floors to be swepped it was done but should be standard I suppose. For the price we paid it was fantastic value. The pool was clean but deep. Kids loved it here and as we have three children fitted them all in. Disappointed advertised shuttle to Disney and Universal only ran once a day, not three times as advertised, but there is good local bus service for $2 and taxis. The fold down murphy bed was extremely comfortable. On site guest laundrette was a bonus. Only down side was noise at night from large American families, but the airconditioning was noisy so you could drowned it out!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: summer042
Reviews.Content: We had a great three week stay at Celebration Suites from mid March to early April. We loved the value and convenience of our spacious suite and enjoyed sitting by the pool in the sun. Although the hotel is a little dated, you can see that it is well maintained. While we were there, all the sofas in our building were replaced with new ones, and several of the suites received new full size refridgerators. The maintenance staff were constantly working to improve the place. When the lock on our door failed to work, maintenance was there immediately to replace it. We were located next door to Old Town. We loved going for a walk there, especially on Friday and Saturday nights to listen to the oldies band and look at the antique and classic cars. When we return to the Orlando area, we will definately stay at Celebration Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Dont ever stay in this hotel ever ever!”
Reviews.Author: Vacaallday
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel stay ever the room was dirty the Tv didnt work we paid for an upgraded room and it was exactly the same as a standard room just closer to the pool. When we spoke to managment they offered us a refund upon checkout (never recevied it) . This hotel is over priced and wouldnt recommend it to anybody. fyi the other reviews thats say it looks low income apartments it truly does...

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT CELEBRATION SUITES, KISSIMMEE, FL”
Reviews.Author: BradTurf
Reviews.Content: Competition is a good thing and there are plenty of other hotels/motels in the Kissimmee/Orlando area to AVOID CELEBRATION SUITES AT ALL COSTS. Here’s a summary of our stay at Celebration Suites: Prior to arrival we received an email from Celebration Suites offering us an early arrival guarantee for $20 when we got there. The check-in time is 4pm so, of course, we wanted early arrival. Upon arrival we were directed to our second floor, barracks-like “suite” passing by essentially an empty barracks complex (so much for early arrival necessity). The look of the place: The State of Florida needs to regulate the marketing of hotels/motels in the Orlando area. The word “suite” should not be allowed when describing the grotesque and filthy appearance of Celebration Suites. After opening the “suite” door with only one of the two keycards that actually worked, we were faced with a dirty old room that, at first glance, did provide the basics of a suite. After “living” there for a few minutes, we realized it provided only aggravation. Here is a synopsis of the “amenities (another word that shouldn’t be allowed!):” A broken stove, a broken hairdryer, a broken and incredibly noisy refrigerator, an air conditioner out of Paranormal Activity striking fear throughout the night, a broken coffee maker (not found out until the first morning when we needed it after a fitful night’s sleep caused by the air conditioner), and a clogging toilet. Really bad. So, we complained to the manager and additional staff who, of course, argued with us, made excuses, and implied that we were in the wrong. Need I say more? Ok one last note: If this was a place that was $40-$50 per night, I could forgive some of the inconvenience. But this place ended up costing $80+ per night. Not much, but after driving by some of their competition you can do a whole lot better the Celebration Suites. This place is a miserable rat hole. Avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Spacious Suites”
Reviews.Author: dgom
Reviews.Content: We decided upon this motel mainly because of the price, but also was nice to have a one bedroom apartment to stay in for four days with full kitchen ( you have to rent your utensils though). Rooms were clean but they did not like to replace stuff that you used - like shampoo/soap/cups. They would leave the dirty cups in the room for you to reuse! When we got there there was a package of coffee along with suger/whitener - they never gave us another - we ended up getting some instant coffee so that we could just heat up water in the microwave. Also forget their so-called breakfast - you had to walk a long way to another building (pouring rain the day we tried it) - once there you had a choice of breakfast bars/oatmeal/sunnydee juice - but only THREE items - these were handed to you by the guy behind the table - felt like we were on rations! We would probably stay there again but be more prepared ie - bring our own coffee/mugs/cutlery etc.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: superdollor
Reviews.Content: I booked this on name your own price with PRICELINE, Used to be a customer of theirs no more after this experience and their attitude. The hotel says well you paid for these rooms but now the price you paid for is not enough and you have to pay for almost everything else plus they charge a huge resort fee and they are not a resort. The bathroom has a toilet plunger in it. I found out the reason why you have to be a plumber to get it to work. The carpet is old and dirty, It is not a hotel, but a multi-buildings 2 story motel and PRICELINE called it 2 star, I wouldn't give it a 1/2 star. some of the lights did not work, housekeeping what was that, one day got 1/2 the towels, didn't take the dirty ones. They gave me a credit for the day they did not even come. I was there for 7 days and let me tell you it wasn't fun. Need ice you will not have to worry about exercise, same complex but not the same building. Their exercise room has 3 pieces of equipment and you must get a pass each and every time for a limited time. The business center does have free internet if you bring your own laptop but you have to get a pass to use it. If not you pay per the minute and the service is slow. You have to go to their business center to use your laptop or pay dearly in your room. Continental Breakfast is additional so we ate across the street. For the few soaps we did receive in 7 days I was surprised that we were not charged extra. The steel fixtures are old, rusty and PRICELINE lost a customer for this "not a chain" hotel. They wouldn't stand behind their service and I wouldn't deal with a company like that again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to the negative reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Blessedwith5
Reviews.Content: My children (ages 20, 16, 15, 7 and 4) and I stayed here over the weekend. I was a little worried since there are quite a few negative reviews, but I was pleasantly surprised once we got in our room. It's hard to find a room that accommodates me and all the kids (without having to book 2 rooms), but the room was huge! It was plenty of room and the price was great. The room was clean and had no problems with housekeeping or any staff there. Although the hotel is older, it was clear to see that they had recently renovated the room. It was nice to be able to walk to Old Town and many other stores and places to eat. There were a lot of people out Saturday night at Old Town but there was a security guard between the hotel and Old Town so I never felt concerned. It was overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience, no trouble, close to the parks!”
Reviews.Author: mangfallmaster
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay there, everything worked out great and I even got early check in. Everything was clean and comfortable. They have shuttles to the major parts a couple of times a day. Only downside is they charge for WiFi - no go :)

Reviews.Title: “Cheapo-should be avoid”
Reviews.Author: raymon46
Reviews.Content: We were three in mid march sharing the apartment. The room was OK but the service room was poor. This appartment was supposed to be equiped for kitchen and we had to rent the dishes, ustensils and toaster. We had to wait more than three hours to get the dishes and the rest. They pretend to offer free WI-FI but not in the apartment. I had to walk with my pc 500 meters and leave my driver permit or passport. While I start my shaving I had noticed that the water faucet was very leak. They told me that is purposly deviced to avoid waste water.

Reviews.Title: “Another great vacation at Celebration Suites!”
Reviews.Author: Hivolts
Reviews.Content: We love this place and have such a great time every time we go there. The renovations/improvements look fantastic. The place was packed on our visit, I hope you guys made a ton of money to help pay for the improvements. My whole family including my dog just loves your place and we look forward to our next stay at Celebration Suites. Keep up the great job.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: tacosson
Reviews.Content: The room was very spacious and housekeeping kept it nice and clean. The biggest downfall to the room was that everything needed to be updated. It was obvious that everything was old and in poor condition (aside from the brand new mattresses). Supposedly they are in the process of renovating rooms, which is a plus. Another negative is the housekeepers would forget to leave wash cloths or hand towels. Overall the room was a good value and if you're looking for a place to simply spend the night and be able to cook some dinner at the same time, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was far from a celebration, it was a scary mess!”
Reviews.Author: disappointedoo7
Reviews.Content: Celebration Hotel was the absolute worse hotel i have ever stayed in, i knew i should have left when they didn't have my reservation that was made on-line, then to only proceed to the 2 rooms we had for me, 2 children an husband, an one room for my in-laws to read the long list of warnings of crime and loitering that goes on in an around the building. needless to say i didn't do much sleeping because of the partying that went on outside my room, the dirty an disgusting rooms that were so old actually made me sick to even sit down, i would have slept in my car outside the airport which we were headed to early the next morning that was why we stayed here! the hotel should be condemed an closed down forever!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Value”
Reviews.Author: FloriduhGirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Celebration Suites for one night with some friends while we were passing through the Kissimmee area. We were really surprised at the size of the rooms and the amenities given the price. They have a full bedroom, kitchen, and living room, and the kitchen had a large refrigerator and dishwasher. We had three people, and we each had our own bed, which was very nice. There are a lot of stores and restaurants next to the hotel, so we actually were able to walk to dinner. I would say this would be a great place to stay if you want to be close to everything and you need/like a lot of space, it was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Disgust.”
Reviews.Author: LeStelleDiLuce
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in, the Celebration Suites were anything but a celebration. Our suite seemed to be clean when we got in, but it turned out that there were little bugs on the night stand that looked like baby ants. They swarmed the bedside table, and were found in many of the other rooms of people in our group. We also had a towel that, when I unrolled it, had a large knot of long, black hair inside of it. All the girls in our room have bright blonde hair. Additionally, the next day, one of our new towels had red lipstick on it, after having just been replaced. The water tasted disgusting, and the rooms were dingy and not fixed up recently. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, and convenient”
Reviews.Author: schen8
Reviews.Content: nice. There was a full kitchen, and the fridge came in handy. The multiple sinks, one in the bathroom and one in the bedroom was nice to have. We did not go to Disney, which made it okay to be at a distance from all the tourists and traffic out that way. It was so very convenient to have stores and restaurants that we could walk to, such as Dunkin Donuts when we went to breakfast. It was not very far from Downtown Orlando and the park Old Town is nice. There are bars in Old Town and a small carnival-like theme park which was nice. My friend and I just walked over and hung out at Old Town one night. My friend and I enjoyed our stay and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in the action.”
Reviews.Author: matfam5
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here on and off for 18 years, it started with grsndma and grandpa. They now live in Florida, so wevisit them every year and take two days for us and stay at the Celebration Suites. It is right next to Old Town and close to the parks, also many places to eat, shop and play mini golf. We will continue to stay there for many years to come and we have also told friends about it and they stay there too. You can't ask for a better place to stay and be close to all the action. Kyle Matott

Reviews.Title: “Well worth choosing!”
Reviews.Author: tpariso24
Reviews.Content: Though this hotel could use some new paint, it was great! Located on 192 only 10 minutes away from DIsney parks and on the strip of a million other things to do. The room was clean, and housekeeping even organized our kids stuffed animals on the bed when they made it! THe pool was clean, gameroom was nice and staff was pleasant. This is a great hotel for anyone and we would stay again if we are in that area!!!!

Reviews.Title: “basic”
Reviews.Author: harty_11
Reviews.Content: stayed here2 nights, hotel is very basic wouldnt like to think i was staying longer than we did. For the price we paid though it was a cheap stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointing”
Reviews.Author: baybmd
Reviews.Content: This hotel advertises that it is close to the Orlando attractions and provides free shuttle service. In fact there are only 2 shuttles/day( one leaving and one coming back ) to the parks at inconvient times. They stuff everyone into the bus with standing room only. to take a cab back and forth is $35.00. The rooms are outdated, lights and TV remotes did not work, locker for valuables did not have key. When notified, this was not rectified. Outside the property is not well kept, with trash strewn about. There was visable mold on the walls. They charge extra if you want to have dishes/utensils for the kitchen. They offer a very inadequate breakfast for a small price. They are located next to a very sleazy Old Town that they bill as having numerous restuarants and attractions. We would have left had we not prepaid. Internet is not free, business center and fitness center and kids arcade a joke.Maid did not even come one of the days.

Reviews.Title: “A good value, great location but they seem to need more staff”
Reviews.Author: JDRCapeCod
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving we were told that check-in wasn't until 4:00. We returened at 4:00 and had to wait about 40 minutes until the room was cleaned. We also learned that you need to rent the dishes and silverware for $10 if you want to use the kitchen that is part of the suite. The room was large and had brand new carpeting, everything else in the room was outdated (bad, dirty wallpaper, olde furniture, etc.) but it was appropriate for the price of the room. There were two TVs, a balcony, and a kichen complete with dishwasher. The biggest problem was getting the room cleaned. They just forgot about cleaning our room and I had to call to get it done. Overall I would stay here again and it was a good value for what we paid. The location is great and the pool was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Was not anything like advertised - will not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: AngelSD
Reviews.Content: The room was not dirty per se, but in complete disrepair. We were in building I and it doesn't appear that anything has been fixed or updated since 1980. The wallpaper was old, discolored, peeling and large water stains under the sink. The linoleum floor in the kitchen had stains. The furniture was old and needed refinished or replaced. There were not even bedspreads on the beds. We had 3 beds with sheets and a blanket. The wood trim on the door in the bathroom had holes from rotting at the bottom and poorly done patches in other areas where you could see the tape covering the hole that was just painted over the same color. The toilet paper holder was completely rusted as well as the fixture in the leaky tub faucet. It's advertised with a kitchen, which it does have a refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave and stove which will not be of any use to you unless you happen to travel with your own dishes and eating utensils. There is not even a toaster for pop-tarts. So you can store drinks in the fridge and make microwave popcorn - which you can do in a lot of hotel rooms. There are safety tips taped to the cabinets suggesting you always use the deadbolt etc. and a sign in the bathroom to let you know they are taking inventory daily of all towels and you'll be charged if you try to steal their thin towels. The Coke machine outside of our room was broken and the coin slot looked like someone tried to pry it open. It was certainly not what we expected at all. I was very disappointed and wouldn't stay there again. If we had not prepaid through the travel agency that we had used, I would have looked for another hotel nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Not What You Think????? HOTEL-PLUS & GUEST SMILE.Celebration Suites”
Reviews.Author: tommoCornwall
Reviews.Content: Celebration!!!! well we thought Disney built it so it must be good but to our disgust it was an old Days Inn that has been taken over but not overhauled with cigarette burns in the bed linen .Stale smoke smells in the room and we were told by a neighbour that it was used to house down and outs recently.I booked online through (Hotel-Plus ) Guest Smile.for ten days on our booking we asked for and it was confirmed a Pool-View with a walk-in shower NOT OVER A BATHTUB.On arrival they could not provide this so we left after one night which i paid for seperately.After repeated calls i have still not received my money back from them.After Googling their name i am distressed but not suprised to see i am not the only one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Location, Price, and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Hotelie_Cornell
Reviews.Content: Choosing a hotel near disney can be very time consuming and stressful. Upon extensive research of hotels in the area my friends and I decided to stay at Celebration Suites ( a family oriented hotel only two miles from the parks). The hotel provided my friends and I with excellent service, a prime location, and the best value in the area for the price. We choose Celebration Suites as our preffered hotel because all of the rooms were suites and large enough to accomodate up to six people at an AMAZING PRICE. Our suite included a huge living room, a full kitchen so we could cook, as well as a seperate bedroom which offered some privacy, unlike most hotels. This was great because our girlfriends came along with us. The staff at Celebration Suites were very proffesional and friendly. They offered us a free mouse pad and coffee mug when we checked in, which went above and beyond my expectations. The housekeeping staff did an excellent job cleaning our room, and the front desk staff always had answers for the many questions we had regarding disney. They were also very effective in responding to our every need. I highly recommend Celebration Suites as your place to stay when visiting the Kissimmee/ Orlando area. It's a great place for every one of all ages, and the value can simply not be beaten, Check it out for yourself: http://www.suitesatoldtown.com/suitedeal.html

Reviews.Title: “Roach in bathroom, rooms not clean. Service was very good though.”
Reviews.Author: rachelflam
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through expedia and got a really good deal. This was very very cheap. for more than 10 years now i will only book hotels after reading tripadvisor reviews. I base everything on these reviews. This hotel got so many good and excellent reviews that I was overly excited about this deal. we arrived in FL at 11:00 PM tired and wanting a bed to sleep in asap. we checked into this hotel and got a room. At first sight i was not impressed with the external appearance of the hotel. It looked old but you never know whats inside. I've been surprised before. The room was old and made me quite uncomfortable immedaitely. the kitchen cabinets, floor, carpets, walls, furniture, everything - was old and either cracked, chipped or peeling. I figured that for what i paid - this is what there is and its fine. I'm really not picky. all i want is clean. we unpacked our things and i went to the bathroom. there was a roach climbing on the wall. When i looked a little more there were a few other bugs there too. We spoke to Wendel at the front desk and he was very nice. apologized and said he would give us another room which was renovated and upgraded. I figured he was giving us the best room he had to make up for the roach incident. Second room was same as first but with new carpet. New carpet doesnt make up for old everything else and most especially a dirty toilet. Obviously - the cleaning staff is not doing a very good job. wendel offered to show us 5 other rooms but at that point i was pretty disgusted and was just itching all over and wanted a refund. he told expedia they would refund the full amount and that was that. wendel was very proffessional and nice and i thank him for that. My suggestion for this hotel: the rooms need some serious upgrading and work. Its not just about changing the carpets. Everything in the rooms needs to be updated and new. The furniture is old, kitchen is old (everything about it) bathtubs are chipped and cracked, countertops are old and discolored and cracked. Even for someone with standards that are not high - its not a great feeling to stay somewhere where everything is old and in bad shape. And that's with no bugs and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Family-oriented hotel”
Reviews.Author: disfam5
Reviews.Content: During the month of December 2010, our family had some issues with the hotel.  Initially, we were not satisfied with the response of the front desk clerk.  Once we established contact with management, our concerns were listened to and investigated.  Actually, the general manager himself reached out to us and offered us options to make certain we were 100% satisfied. We too noticed that the trash was overflowing from dumpsters.  What we later learned was that the building our room was located in was completely renovated that week, and what we were seeing was construction waste that the contracted dumpster company did not show up to remove in a timely manner.  We have also learned that there has been some pretty extensive renovations throughout much of the hotel. The hotel is conveniently located within minutes of Disney.  It is also next to Old Town, which is nice if you have children.  There are lots of reasonably priced restaurants and shops in the area.  The rates are affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Needs major cleaning and updating”
Reviews.Author: gboatgirl
Reviews.Content: We got a really good deal on hotwire, but we didn't know which hotel till we booked. It ended up being this one. The place has a lot of potential. I really liked the size of the rooms and the fact that it had a kitchen, living room and bedroom. It was nice to have a separate space for the kids to take a nap or go to bed early. It was convenient to Disney World as well. If only the rooms were taken better care of and updated better it would be a really great place. Unfortunately it needs some serious work. I had read the reviews on here before checking in, so as soon as we got there I checked our room to see what I would find. I was nervous about the complaints of bugs, etc. I was not at all impressed with my quick walk around. The kitchen floor was quite dirty and cracked, peeling stained wallpaper, the interior of the fridge was very rusty. There were multiple hairs on ALL three of the sink/counter areas (kitchen, bathroom and bedroom vanity). The couches and chairs were stained as well as the carpet. When I walked in the radio on the alarm clock was blaring as loud as possible on a very uninviting station, and the alarm it self was so ancient, as was everything else. I was thoroughly unimpressed so we went back to the front desk and asked if they had any better rooms. The person acted shocked and incredulous when I informed him that the room seemed dirty and there were hairs on all the counters, but he willingly switched us rooms to two doors down. The next room was a slight improvement, the fridge was in better condition, the alarm clock, coffee maker and other appliances were a little more updated. The kitchen floor was less cracked, although it was still not clean to my standards. It looked like the maids probably just push a mop around once quickly, not bothering to get into corners or do anything more than that. With the room being so old that leaves a lot of grime build up. In the bathroom the tub was stained, the toilet cracked, and the mirror was missing huge spots of the reflective backing. The sofa and living room chairs were very stained, as well as the carpet. The sofa was a sleeper sofa without the mattress in it, this made the cushions sink way down in an awkward way. The sheets on the bed were quite stained and yellowed, I could hardly bring myself to crawl into them at night. Luckily I had brought my own pillow so I didn't have to put my face on them. Also, both rooms were missing the numbers outside the door, so it took us a minute to figure out which one it was. I have three young children including one toddler who still sometimes crawls around a bit, and it really gave me the willeys to have her crawl on the dirty floor. I would not recommend this place at all for very young children who don't know to stay off the floor. I was very glad we were only using the room as a place to crash at night, it would not be a place I would want to spend time in. It was nice having a full size fridge and freezer to keep food in so we could eat breakfast and make things to take with us for lunches and snacks. I really wanted the hotel to work out better. Like I said in the beginning it has really great potential. If our room had been remodeled and clean it would have been a great place to stay. Unfortunately the way it was is unacceptable. Having said all that there may be a chance that some rooms are better than what we had. I read that they are supposedly replacing the carpets right now. Also, there was a section of buildings in an area by the front office, and another section across the street. We were in the ones across the street and it is possible that the ones by the front office might be a little more presentable, but I don't know. I do think that we got what we paid for (which was less than thirty). However, I would have been very upset had I paid the sixty dollars or so that the rooms were going for online. This hotel is definitely not the 2 1/2 stars listed on hotwire. And the funny thing is if you go to the hotels website and click on the powerpoint show it says "what follows are details of the amenities which clearly make us three stars." Ummmm, it doesn't really matter what kind of "amenities" you offer if your rooms are that dumpy there is no way you can be three stars. Also, the TVs got very few channels, on Saturday morning when I was trying to entertain my kids while the rest of us got ready we could not even find any kids shows except one in Spanish. The internet did work but it was an extra fee everyday. We never took advantage of the breakfast. For $1.50 each you could choose four items such as a banana, granola bar, donut, oj, or other cheap prepackaged stuff. We preferred to use our fridge and eat in our room. Also, there is a $5/per day "resort fee" that is not included in your room rate. I think this hotel might be ok for someone if they got a good enough price and they were not picky about cleanliness. If they redid the rooms and cleaned them better I would be all for staying here because of the size and convenience, but until then I will be staying away.

Reviews.Title: “Celebration Suites has came a long way from 2 years ago!”
Reviews.Author: kiml3818
Reviews.Content: We were there last weekend and Celebration Suites is doing a great job improving the place we have been staying there for the past 14 years was nice as Days suites NASTY as suites at old town and becoming SUPER NICE as Celebration suites Keep up the good work I cant wait to come and stay again. Beautiful new carpet, blankets, beds, drapes and furniture. Room smelled so clean and fresh. Building O #2415 We have never had a problem with our vehicle in all the years we have stayed on that property and when ever we had a problem in the past with a tv or something they were quick to come and fix it. You can leave you vehicle the whole time you are there and walk to anything you might need.

Reviews.Title: “In all honesty, I don't recommend”
Reviews.Author: kaag25
Reviews.Content: The rooms reminded me of an old, worn out dorm room with the murphy bed in the wall and all the older, cheap furniture. When we first arrived, it took us a good 20 minutes to find our room because the room number had fallen off and no one had replaced it. The walls were super thin, you could hear the person snoring in the room next to you. The place was more like somewhere you would party hard at with a bunch of your friends, not take your family. The carpets were stained and looked like they had not been cleaned in years. I left my shoes on the entire time I was there. The room had a nice sized kitchen but if you wanted something to cook in you had to rent it from the front office. If you like to watch TV, forget about it here. There were only about 10 channels that came in clearly and the TV's were very, very old and small. The TV in the bedroom didn't even have a remote control. There is also no internet connection in any of the hotel rooms. If you want to connect you have to go to their "business center". When I went to take a shower the whole faucet came out of the wall. It went back in, thank god, but I had to be careful turning the shower on and off. There was also absolutely no water pressure in the shower or the sinks. Also, as we were packing up to leave the toilet just stopped flushing for no reason. The hotel is literally 20ft from Old Town, which is like a little fair. Friday and Saturday nights it was a nightmare; There was no parking anywhere near our hotel room because people going to Old Town had parked in the hotel parking lot. All throughout the night you can hear people screaming on the rides. There were also many people that were loud and obnoxious just hanging out in the parking lot near the hotel rooms. If you are a girl, don't even try to walk around at night or even go out onto your patio by yourself because you will be yelled at and followed by the guys lingering in the parking lot. My opinion is the place is just old, dirty, falling apart and in desperate need of renovations. It has potential, but as of now its just gross.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value; close proximity to everything I like”
Reviews.Author: Rixrod
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here about 16-18 times over the last dozen years and have brought my family and MANY members of our car club to stay here as well. It is certainly no Ritz-Carlton, but I don't want a Ritz-Carlton!! It is very affordable and close to Old Town which is the reason for our visits. I guess some of the others reviewing these suites take themselves a little to serious. Sure they're old and there aren't many updates(although they were painted and remodeled before we got there in 2010) but they're great for what we need. You can't get a new and great place for $60/night. If you don't like these, go down the street and spend $130/night and either drive or hike back to Old Town!! GREAT value for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: tramconductor
Reviews.Content: We've known of the suites for many years but usually stay in Motel/Hotels and decided to try it because of the extra facilities over a hotel room. After booking I checked out this site and was a little concerned by some of the adverse reviews but went with it anyway. We were pleasantly surprised it was 'what it said on the tin', yes it could do with a makeover but we are in difficult times. The staff are very welcoming and friendly and the suites offer a good standard, everything you need for a holiday out visiting and when you want to stay in its ideal. Great location with all the usual eating places around, some near enough to walk to. Good connections for the courtesy bus pick-ups for the parks. If you insist on 5 Star only accommodation forget it, if you want good practical value for money go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value with accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: ahmedrahim00
Reviews.Content: I frequently have to travel in to visit some clients in the Kissimmee area, and I'll be frank....I was very pleased with particular visit. The Room size was larger than expected, and the kitchen was exceptionally convenient. Staff was helpful and friendly with directions as well (GPS only helps you so far!) Location was also nice as well being so close to Old Town! Very lively. Overall, I was very happy with my relaxing stay, especially after a 10hr work day!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: merryberry61
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at Old Town on vacation the last 2 years and had a great stay ,people were very nice and the suite was very clean and neat.

Reviews.Title: “Met all our Needs - Comforts of Home”
Reviews.Author: alt7898
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights there with family and extended family before Christmas, and we had everything we needed to make the stay perfect from an economical and convenience standpoint. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite which also has a murphy bed and slept 4 adults and 2 children quite comfortable. The kitchen was pefect for making meals/snackes prior to heading out to the parks. Be sure to request the plates/utensils/glasses in advance for a small fee. Rooms were cleaned in a timely manner and the front desk staff was friendly and accommodating. We went during a busy time, so the staff was able to handle the high volume with ease. I also heard that the property is putting a significant amount of money into updgrading decor, furniture, etc, which will make it even more desirable. In walking distrance to many restaurants and Old Town. Heated pool was great for the kids, as well as the playground. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: schmangerine
Reviews.Content: After arriving I was a little nervous about leaving my vehicle in the parking lot, but decided to check it out anyway. I checked in, got into my room and the TV had been stolen, the fridge was rusty, not the greatest room, but whatever it was cheap. They brought in a TV from 1975 and I was OK. I left for dinner and when I got back I pulled the sheets back to get into the bed and it was crawling with bugs! I'm so happy there happened to be adult bed bugs on the top sheet so that I didn't find out about the bed bugs too late. Needless to say my money was refunded.

Reviews.Title: “Boomerang”
Reviews.Author: Yas1003
Reviews.Content: I stayed here and October 2009 and came back in 2010... Why? Location is awesome! Shuttle to the parks and attractions! Huge, comfortable rooms. Great for family and kids. Lots of shopping and restuarants within walking distance. Full size fridge and kitchen. I was impressed by the updates management made to the lobby and rooms. I thought it was a great value in 2009 and was even better in 2010. Can't wait to come back in 2011!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the huge rooms, full kitchens, friendly staff, and location”
Reviews.Author: MISHNA
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for Thanksgiving and loved the huge rooms, full kitchen, friendly staff, and location! Very close to the Disney resort and staff was extremely pleasant and helpful! Rooms were bigger than average. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “needs some updating”
Reviews.Author: biker508
Reviews.Content: was a great location near old town did not beleive they charge $10.50 to rent pot&pans. bus service was great

Reviews.Title: “Got to stay in the new 2-Bedroom Suites!”
Reviews.Author: MrMike33325
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Celebrations Suites a few times over the years, but this time, November 2010, I thought I would have to find a different hotel with bigger suites since I was traveling with more family members than ever before, but then I noticed they were upgrading some rooms to new 2-Bedroom Suites. I knew I wanted to come here, because I love the location in Kissimmee, less than a 10 minute drive from Disney World and other Orlando Attractions, yet literally walking distance from the Old Town and Fun Spot USA, which offers its own selection of rides, nightclubs, live shows, and many impressive restaurants (I recommend Flippers Pizza after a long day at the theme parks!) But what I didn't know was if they could successfully pull off the two bedroom suite... When I got there, I was thrilled to find that the 2BR Suite was pulled off to perfection. 1 bedroom had a queen size bed and a vanity sink. The other bedroom had 2 standard beds, a couch that can pull out into another bed, and a fully equipped master bathroom. There was a kitchen with microwave, stove, fridge / freezer and dining table. There was also a living room with a Murphy bed and another couch which can convert to a pullout bed. There are 3 televisions total. So as you can tell from my description, the hotel was huge and slept my entire family comfortably. Even my cat! I stayed in this hotel for over 1 full week, and the service was great! The room was spacious, the room was clean, and the rates were unbelievably cheap. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone staying in the Kissimmee area who loves the "tourist" side of vacation, and enjoys the convenient location... Big family or small!

Reviews.Title: “Unsatisfied Guest”
Reviews.Author: ritchie9530
Reviews.Content: On December 22 - 27, 2010, my family and I were guest at the Celebration Suites. We resided in room 1305, Building I. During our stay, we did not receive any quality room service. Everyday our beds were made to no type of standard, our floor was never vacuumed and trash was emptied but no garbage bag was left in the can. I had to actually go outside and get a bag from the big trash can in front of our room. Everyday we came back to the room, it appeared as if the service personnel onyl changed the towels he or she could visually see then left out. I remember specifically a rag hanging on the shower curtain rod that was there for two days and they never changed it. The desk where the sink was in our room was never wiped down and neither was the bathroom counter. I specifically had asked for two extra blankets and was only given one. When the service personnel came in the next morning to so call clean the room, they took that one back. Your ironing board was a waste of time, it was too small and kept flopping down. I had to iron on the bed or put a towel on the floor because it was never vacuumed so our clothes would not get dirty. The bathroom shower was protruding from the wall and it leaked all day and night, where we could barely sleep listening to the shower leaking. The water pressure was extremely low in both the bathroom sinks and kitchen. I was very dissapointed in our stay here and I would not come back or recommend this hotel to anyone else. Had I not already paid for the room in advance I would have left and went to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Lancashirelass39
Reviews.Content: As my friend and I are both over 65yrs and do not drive, we found the location excellent. The staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were cleaned daily and the kitchen was well equipped. The pool area was clean and the pool itself heated. The only complaint was being unable to use a phone card on the telephone in the bedroom. We would certainly return to this hotel and have no hesitation in recommending it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, great service, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: thevoutts
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 different times in December one time for 4 nights and the next time 2 nights. We had a great experience. The second time were given a less then desirable room but we simply called the front desk and they put us back in our rooms from before. We were traveling with 4 families and had 4 seperate rooms and we were all very satisfied with our rooms and the friendly staff that helped us any time we called. I LOVE being so close to OLD TOWN, we went there almost every night. Would def recommend for a family as the space is great for larger families.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Family Trip”
Reviews.Author: melanie120299
Reviews.Content: We felt very happy with the hotel "Celebrations Suites" because we felt like if we where at home.The suites are very cozy.The kitchen has everything a woman could need to cook for her family a delicious meal,something very important is that this hotel has a huge "Refridgerator" and the other hotels have a small refridgerator!The "Living Room" is very peaceful because the family is more united.The master bedroom has a very beautiful view because it has it's very own balcony like a real house!The bathroom is very clean and ,the room service employes are very sweet and kind to us.Lastly, the breakfast is well prepared and very delicious to eat and the hotel allows pets to stay too.That's why the hotel "Celebrations Suites" is the number 1 hotel in Kissimme,Florida!

Reviews.Title: “A Central America 5 star hotel is an American 1 star.....”
Reviews.Author: Travelnomad64
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed outside of the Disney resorts so my perspective and expectations I admit are quite high! The only reason why I veered from my routine was that I had traveled with my two pets. Granted they charge only $10 a night per pet. I paid a grand total of $97 for one single night which consisted of exactly 10 hours. I found the hotel to be Old, destroyed, the room I had had disgusting carpets and a dirty kitchen floor. I was beyond myself. The genius at the front desk thought it was a good idea to put us on the second floor so that walking the dogs as I do several times would be more of a challenge and a better excersise. The place was a ghost town as well as totally an old town. Not even my dogs who had spent the day before at the groomers getting cleaned and beautiful wanted to walk inside or outside of the place. If you are used to staying in Cheap old hotels I guess this would be a great deal. For $1.50 you get four small little packets of snacks like those that come in multiple packets at BJ's or Costco and the worst coffee I have ever tasted in my life. I slept with the lights on just to discourage any Mexican cucarachas from coming out of their nest during the night. And no, I did not see any bugs, thank god for that! Old, in need of a total renovation a la American style, like taking down that old wall paper which is screams at the corners to be released from decades of being on the wall and that rug which can take not one more monthly vacumn. The Murphy Beds one day are going to come down and stay off their corroded hinges. Everything is rusted, holes in the corners, doors eaten up by who knows what... The only celebration in Celebration suites is the dance you do once you rush out of little Tijuana as I like to call it. I am Cuban by the way and having traveled to both Central and South American I can tell you this people think of their stars on the basis of South American stars. Yes there's a roof above your head and I don't know if it can contain the rain in a diluge. I hated the place and No never would I return to such a dilapidated property. In fairness of review, my sister felt it was ok, of course she was not aware of the $97 I had paid. How can you make it better?? Tear down the place and build it over or charge what it represents, $9.99 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Stay ever”
Reviews.Author: greenfinch65
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the worst ever. The hotel is old and dingy. The staff are not helpful. They are cheap, cheap. From the time we arrived there was nothing but problems. The refrigerator was not working for 2 days after numerous complaints the staff finally switched the refrigerator, meanwhile we lost food. No apoligies whatsoever. Every day there was another issue. No shampoo, no coffee, no kleenex. You go to a hotel so you don't have to worry about things. It was constant every day. Everything was available for a price, Dishes, Toaster, pots, towels. You are better off staying somewhere else. Did not need the headaches. F

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotelo”
Reviews.Author: joconneely
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel in March 2010 and will stay there everytime we go to Kissimmee. The location is awesome and the room you get for the money is incredible. There are plenty of amentities to enjoy and the overall experience has always been a great one!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location!!”
Reviews.Author: abbaskanji
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome. You can't beat the location and the price. Plus its very clean and the service was better than expected. Highly recommended and I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “THE GREATEST COSTUMER SERVICE IHAVE EXPERIENCE IN A HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: carla_garbo
Reviews.Content: I had my thanksgiving vacation with my husband Mike it was very busy day we were tired and not feeling happy when we got to the celebration suites a lady in the front desk, if i am not mistaking Rocco or Rocio was the greatest to be greeted by with a big smile on her face offering all kinds of amenities for our self's made us feel special once we got our room she gave us a call to make sure everything was fine. That made us feel even better like a VIP. the room was very clean and presentable. transportation on time and best thing we had Old Town walking distance. staying at this hotel was very pleasant. A big Thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worthwhile”
Reviews.Author: mr_guns
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my wife and two grown-up kids. Finding a place big enough is not easy, then the price usually will set you back. Celebration Suites rooms are very large. The bedroom is as large as most hotels, then you got a small kitchen and living room with a pull down bed. The price was great and the beds were very comfortable. Location was right next to Old Town you don't have to drive around anything we needed was within walking distance. If you want luxury go elsewhere, if you want a decent place to stay with lots of room Celebration Suites at Old Town it the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “We had an enjoyable visit”
Reviews.Author: charlotteb55
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Celebration Suites when it was called Suites at Old Town, but it had been a few years since we had last stayed there. We were there for 4 nights during the week of Thanksgiving to visit Disney and also took the grand kids to Old Town and Fun Spot USA, which are both right next door and which they absolutely love. I became a member of their Facebook fan page and I had read about the improvements they were making. I also saw pictures posted of the new game room, children's playground, basketball court, business center, and gym. None of these were there the last time we stayed about 3 years ago. We reserved a Superior suite with a King-sized bed in the bedroom - these are new to the hotel because it did not offer King-sized beds the last time we were here. Wow, was it comfortable! Our grand kids are 6 & 8 year's old and they slept in the pull-down bed in the bedroom which also you could see had a new mattress. We all slept very well and there were 6 pillows in our room - we loved that. Check-in was smooth and the front desk agent who greeted us, Jose, was extremely pleasant. We told him we really liked the new look of the lobby which has been re-done very tastefully and he welcomed us back like we were old friends. The rooms here are very spacious and ours was clean and had no odor to it. I've read many complaints about noise here, but can say that since this hotel is so large, there are plenty of rooms close to Old Town for those who prefer to be close to the action as well as rooms further away where you won't hear a peep. We were located in Bldg. A and noise wasn't an issue when we were there. Pools were heated and were very nice and clean. I read on Facebook that new carpets are coming in a few months...I can only imagine how much better it will be next time we bring the kids to Orlando which will probably be during Spring break holiday. This last trip was relaxing and fun for all of us. We will certainly be coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great all round”
Reviews.Author: dawsy
Reviews.Content: I recently had a trip to Kissimmee with 2 friends for a week, for xmas shopping..... oh and eating and drinking of course :) . I have been to the Orlando area a few times and usually have been in a villa (all are always fantastic) with my wife and 3 kids, this trip was a lads week away. We stayed at the celebration suites and I was a little apprehensive to be honest after reading a few reviews, mainly around the cleanliness, but decided to stay here as it was the best value/location for a room sleeping 3 and we didn't plan on being in the room very much as it was just a place to crash out at night. I booked through a website that gave me a very good rate, not direct from their own website. We were greeted at check in by a very nice lady called Jean who got us processed and in our room in short time, explaining that should we need wifi that was extra ($12 for the week which I had already checked out) or cutlery which we could order now (we didn't bother). We had a 1 bedroom superior suite which was very clean and had all the basics such as fridge, cooker, microwave and table to eat at in the kitchen although if you had more than 4 or 5 people it would have been a bit of a squeeze around the table. The bedroom had 2 double beds, a tv and doors leading out onto a balcony and the mainroom had a murphy bed that the 3rd member of the party slept in also with a tv and a sofa that was probably a sofa bed, although we didn't open it. We didn't end up using any of the 3 pools, I did dip my feet in one and it was at a pleasantly warm and clean looking. All round although the rooms were basic, they were Clean with good facilities and fantastic location, you could not possibly get closer to old town!. Last year there were only 2 of us and we stayed at the sera lago about 2 mins away which was also good and I wouldn't put people off of it, but this will be my 1st choice should we return as you get a 1 bedroom suite for the same price as a studio in sera lago. As a note, although the wifi was not free it was good enough to stream the football on my laptop so the connection must be pretty good, and anyone staying around oldtown should try Logans Roadhouse for dinner... Probably the best place to eat I have found.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lscooter1980
Reviews.Content: For the price this place cannot be beat! I've gone to Orlando twice a year since 2005 and I've always stayed at this hotel. I've seen it go from a bank owned property to what it is today and the accommodations have only gotten better. They've recently vamped up some of their rooms with brand new furniture, they have a new game room, gym and business center. Even the lobby has had a recent makeover and it looks GREAT. For a money saving stay that provides convenience and space this is the place. PLUS, it's right next door to Old Town Kissimee, FL and you can walk there from your room. They have a very friendly and accommodating staff and I'll continue to stay in this hotel for the price and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Best visit yet!”
Reviews.Author: Nayahskillz
Reviews.Content: Big ups to the manger, Jose, for taking care of us and making us feel welcomed as always! Great location to get to Disney. Very clean rooms and amenities inside. Security kept the parking lot clear for the guests, especially being next to Old Town. A wonderful stay. There are many resorts in the area, but the warmth from the staff and manager, Jose, make us come back year after year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Eds_Better_Half
Reviews.Content: Our family has stayed at Celebration Suites (formerly Suites at Old Town) since the 80’s. It is a great hotel for families traveling with children. They are more like apartments than hotels at a value price. The kitchen area allows you to cook meals in the room instead of having to spend money at restaurants and fast food. The living room gives you more space to be comfortable, as well as extra sleeping space with the Murphy bed and sleeper sofa. The staff is always pleasant and helpful with anything we may need. The hotel is located next door to Old Town. Being able to walk over and enjoy the attraction is a bonus in our book. Though there are many rooms, this hotel is always quiet at night. We often take mini-vacations from Jacksonville to Kissimee and CS is the first hotel we go to for reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond!”
Reviews.Author: TKincaid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Celebration Suites this past weekend (Nov. 12th & 13th) and had the best experience! The accommodations were excellent - we had a King Superior room facing Old Town, which provided easy access to the attractions and entertainment throughout our stay! However, that wasn't the highlight - the best part of our stay was the staff!!! Linday, Maurreen and Jose provided exceptional service and ensured all our needs were met! They certainly went above and beyond and honestly cared about making our trip as enjoyable as possible. One added touch was the balloon they brought to our room Friday evening for our son's birthday. I mentioned it was his birthday in the notes when I booked the room and never expected anything special, but they really went out of their way to show they cared. Awesome!!!! We will definitely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Celebration suites is VERY family friendly”
Reviews.Author: maremoore00
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at Celebration suites for a few years now. We love the spacious rooms. In march my husband, Daughter, son inlaw, grandbabies, & our 2 dogs spent my 50th birthday there. We went swimming in one of there pools. Spent time in the large kitchen making cup cakes. Grandkids just loved it! The location is close to all attractions, shopping, restaurants, & old town. The staff went out of there way to make sure we had everything we needed. Thank you Celebration suites for the Best birthday ever! See you soon! Mary Moore

Reviews.Title: “Old, but clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: IreneHope
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our daughter and her cat; there was a $10 fee for the cat but it worked out well for her to have some room to explore. Our daughter slept on a murphy bed in one room with a tv and we had the larger room with two beds and a tv. The kitchen and bathroom were in the middle. It was nice to have plenty of room for all of us. The hotel offered breakfast for a fee but we ate in the room. There were no utensils, pots, pans or soap for the sink or dishwasher. We did come prepared so that was not a problem for us. You can walk to some of the local attractions and there are plenty of places to eat nearby. There is also a grocery store across the street. Again, it is somewhat old and not updated, but it worked well for our family! The hotel does offer shuttle service to some of the local attractions, but we did not use if.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: brobida44
Reviews.Content: Ants on all sinks and on table.The faucet in the tub and sink never shut off. Front desk was not very friendly. House keeping had just finished cleaning I know because they had me wait for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your buck. Pet Friendly. In need of redecorating.”
Reviews.Author: Robsmama
Reviews.Content: I used to stay at this hotel with my kids in the 80s and 90s. The Value is still a very good one. It is pet friendly and the place has a lot of room and function. UPgrading is sorely needed. They still have the same wall paper, boders, furniture, and televisions from the 90s. The place is clean though and the beds are comfortable. Some of the buildings that were originally part of Days INN and Suites out back are long term rentals now and look run down and un inviting but as I said... The place in general is still a really good family value.

Reviews.Title: “Works well w/kids”
Reviews.Author: traveler55324
Reviews.Content: Traveled w/my daughter and her two children (3 & 7). This worked out great because we could put them to bed and have a place for adult time. Much better than a "standard" hotel room. The complex is a little older. It's not the Hilton or Marriott but we found the room clean and staff was courteous and helpful. Price was very reasonable. This is just a great set-up for families. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE GUEST SERVICES”
Reviews.Author: legacy09
Reviews.Content: Everytime I called this hotel i had to spend at minimum of 10 minutes on hold because no one would talk to me. Even after our stay we called to ask some questions and were put on hold for 15 minutes. The first room that we had many of the kitchen amenities were broken. The bed was broken. Thankfully, they switched our room but we still had more problems. The wake up service did NOT work two days in a row, and we were late for the start of our day. As well as the no housekeeping services. We had to take towels off the housekeeping carts because we were not able to get new ones on a daily basis. There was also no towels near the pool on some of the days. So we had to bring some of our own towels from the room to the pool in case there was none provided at the pool. Needless to say the "resort fee" was not worth what they had promised.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Space!”
Reviews.Author: leeleesmail
Reviews.Content: Had a good time here at old town with Friends! We stayed 1 night we went to HHN! It was nice to have someone there ready to check us in at 130am. The room was clean and and had extra towels and pillow's. I love how the bathroom is not in the bedroom. We be coming back soon! Also like sleepping on a new mattress! Brain was also very Helpful with all of my questions that I had!

Reviews.Title: “The Last Resort”
Reviews.Author: MsB063
Reviews.Content: At check-in--air not working, tv not working, and phone on the nite stand with no line and phone jack hanging out the wall. Fixed the air to barely cool, brought another tv with out a remote, nothing to the phone or jack! Wall paper peeling, sliding glass door to balcony off track (son was almost locked out), fridge had a big crack on the inside, and to top it off, I saw at least 4 roaches in kitchen area.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious suite, excellent location, fantastic customer service...”
Reviews.Author: fydlstyx
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed in a second floor, poolside suite that consisted of three separate areas and a bathroom. This is really much more similar to a small apartment than to a motel room! There is a murphy bed in the living room, along with a sofa, chairs, and television. Separating the living room from the bedroom is a spacious kitchen and a bathroom. The bedroom had two double beds and sliding glass doors leading to a private balcony. The room was clean enough, but it is clear that there is room for improvement and that management is acting on that and making sure it happens. While we were there, air conditioners were being removed from the rooms and being scrubbed, which our a/c could have definitely used, and I am sure it was on the list to be done after our check out. Towels and linens were spotless, and the beds were comfortable and new. The room smells very clean, and there was no evidence of any kind of bug anywhere inside. If I were to suggest some improvements, I'd say to ditch the $10 rental fee for basic dishware and flatware, although plastic cups are provided, so it was not a big issue for us; put some chairs out on the nice, big balcony, and offer free wi-fi! This is not a five star resort, and they don't bill themselves as one. What it is, is a clean, comfortable, extremely spacious, convenient to EVERYTHING, family centered motel that is very affordably priced. There's a clean game room with all games in new, good working order, and there are snacks and drinks available for purchase from a machine in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: We_R_5_Strong
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to Disney from here. They advertise free shuttle, but we used our own vehicle. The property is definitely old and worn. We found everything in working order. One of our tv's went out and it was fixed right away. We got a really great rate on hotwire and this property was worth our rate. It's a good size suite in a motel setting. Next to Old Town amusement park. You can walk over and it wasn't too crowded this time of year. Also has a game room and a couple of play places for small children. We will probably stay there again next time, especially if we get the hotwire rate. One note: has full size kitchen but if you want pans or anything to use in kitchen, thats an extra fee.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Kissimmee for a family”
Reviews.Author: jhbatten
Reviews.Content: My family and friends have been staying at this hotel at least 2 or 3 times a year since 1990 and it is the perfect location for anything in Kissimmee or Orlando. It is 7 to 10 min. from Disney and 5 min from I-4 which will take you to anyplace you need to go. Which includes Universal, Malls, Holy Lands, Sea World, Airport. It is next door to Old Town which provides entertainment for all ages.
