The service has always been excellent and in all these years i have only had one stay that i had any problems which was addressed by management and we were totally satisfied. This is a very family friendly Hotel. You can cook yourself or eat out with plenty of choice's. The suites are very good size and i hope it will become a family tradition for you as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous for the Price”
Reviews.Author: valeriebock
Reviews.Content: Lots of room and a nice place. I'd recommend that you bring your own towels and ice bucket. Comes with a full-sized fridge and dishwasher but, no plates, etc. Jose was our receptionist. Wonderful guy!

Reviews.Title: “smokers beware ,no smoking allowed but nothing anywhere that states that,and I mean ANYWHERE”
Reviews.Author: lag19
Reviews.Content: If you are a smoker don't stay here. I know that we are dwindling in numbers, but we smokers sre still out there. There is nowhere on their website,on their brouchers,or anywhere on their complex that states they are a non-smoking establishment. In their rooms and on some of their doors there is no smoking, but I see that at every hotel. If you are going to be a completely SMOKE FREE place then it should be fully acknowledged somewhere, like other places I saw, but no not this dump. As you pull into this place it seems very nice, clean, but that just draws you in, take a ride around this place and it looks like the projects. Some of the building look like tenaments. My husband and I took a walk around one night and it was like walking around one of the worst neighborhoods in Camden NJ. You should feel safe at a place where you pay to stay and I was everything but, and it states in the room for your safety walk in pairs, what resort states that. This place is one of thta worst places that we ever stayed at. The don't let smokers smoke, but they let pets stay here does that make sense animals, have fleas can go on the rugs etc. But thats fine with them. Their cleaning staff is another thing, yes we had our clean towels everyday, but I don't think that they own a mop, broom or cleaning supplies. Our bathroom floor or bathroom was never cleaned the entire time we were there. I cleaned the toilet/floor/tub. What kind of S--T is that ,I'm on vacation I can stay home and clean! I advise anyone thinking of staying here DON"T. There are alot of other resorts right around the area that are cleanier and nicer then this, STAY THERE NOT HERE!!! I would not allow my worst enemy to stay at this place. MY advice to this place CLOSE down. Spend some money on advertising that you are SMOKE_FREE and that you no longer look like you do on your web sit eand that you are actually a welfare place. our establishment is just one big false advertisement. You should actually give people their hard earned money back for all the BS that you sling around.

Reviews.Title: “Celebrating vacation!”
Reviews.Author: MrMike33325
Reviews.Content: The Celebration Suites in Kissimmee is a great hotel for any vacation to the area. Located just minutes from Walt Disney World, and within walking distance of night life, restaurants, and amusment rides in Old Town and Fun Spot U.S.A. this hotel is clean, roomy and has a wide variety of suites that include kitchens and living rooms complete with a murphy bed. This is my 4th time staying in this hotel with great rates with my family, and I have to say, I think I'll be coming here for years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time!!!”
Reviews.Author: arocha123
Reviews.Content: My kids love coming here everytime we come to Orlando. The really enjoy going to Old Town and its located in a very convenient area close to everything especially Walgreens which has come in handy a lot of times. The rooms are always kept very clean and they are very comfortable. I will be honest, I had an option of staying at a Hyatt because a friend of mine has a friend who can get us outrageous deals for a suite and I told him that I would not trade Celebration Suites for the Hyatt due to the fun my kids have there. I have been staying there since they were formally Days Inn Suites at Old Town. The customer service is AWESOME as well. The people at the front desk are very attentive and anything you need they are always willing to help. When placing my reservation... Lindy was extremely helpful and you can actually feel the warmth in her voice. She makes wanting to stay there a vacation within a vacation. I totally love this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay at Celebration Suites!”
Reviews.Author: CorleyMom
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a great stay at Celebration Suites. The rooms was clean and neat. The staff was friendly, even making reservations a month before our trip to Kissimmee. It was walking distance to Old Town and just driving minutes to Disney. And we are taking another trip and planning on staying at Celebration Suites this October. I highly recommend checking this place out. Great place and great prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay..”
Reviews.Author: Toadswaggle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Celebration Suites for a week. It was a excellent stay. Th staff was very friendly and professional. The room was cleaned everyday except the day we wanted to rest and told them we didnt want service. They made sure thw room was very clean and always made sure we had clean towels,bedding and plenty of toilet paper. The pool was great and very inviting after a long day touring Kennedy Visitor Complex. There were lotas of restraunts within walking distance and a store near by too. Old Town is right next door and we spent a whole day just enjoying that. There is also minature golf within walking and my kids enjoyed that. The suites at Celebration Suites were large and having a full kitchen for such a great price was wonderful. Th e ten dollar charge for dishes was fair and the 5 dollar resort fee per day was reasonable too. The rooms were very clean andi never saw any bugs. We had a lizard in the kitchen one day,but not sure if it found it's way in or my kids brought it in. We just caught it and put it back outside. The free shuttle to the attractions was great ..was always ontime and there was always plenty of room for everyone. I was very impressed with my stay and we hope to be back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “great location and staff is very accomodating reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: sabwender
Reviews.Content: I have been here numerous times since 1989.They have been in the process of remodeling now for the last 7 mos .But also the town has grown a lot since then .They are so many restaurants ,stores and also old town.So much to do in this area and then disney,universal, sea world and busch gardens and other attractions.They do have a very nice swimming pool here. As for tips, Make sure you have enough towels and coffee for the morning for every one you reg. If not just call and they will bring it to you. Don't order food from the flyers they put on any motel or hotel door whatever place you are staying at .These people come and go.But thats happens in any state you travel too. This hotel has change management ,but the staff in the front office has been there a long time and are extremely nice and will help you .Very nice place to stay if you have a family and reasonable.rates.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a dump!”
Reviews.Author: unhappycamper111
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 9 years ago and were very pleased with it. This time, not so much so. I prepaid back in June for an August visit and received a 20 % discount by doing so. After driving for 17 plus hours, we finally checked into the hotel around 3:00 am and were given an obviously un-renovated room which stunk of old, mold, mildew (and use your imagination). The furniture was disgusting, the blankets/ sheets were dirty and the foldout bed which the kids were so looking forward to had dirt and hair behind it. The stench was so strong, it made it hard to breathe which concerned me with my asthmatic daughter but I felt we had no choice at that point but to stay for the night. We slept for a very short time, enough to recharge our batteries and I was back in the lobby by 8 am advising them that I was checking out and would like a refund at which point the manager on duty told me that there were no refunds granted because I prepaid and received the 20% discount. She stated that I could stay or I could go but no money would be refunded. I told her that I had an asthmatic daughter and that staying there would be detrimental to her at which point she agreed to reimburse me $459 of the original $618 paid (explaining that she was charging me for the night we stayed, as well as the next night because I did not cancel 24 hours ahead of time). I took what I could get at that point and felt I would deal with the attorney general after my vacation. When I checked my bank account to make sure that they reimbursed the money, I realized that they had placed another hold for $618.00 on my account. Apparently the night time clerk had considered us a no show because we checked in after midnight and he re-charged the account (which had already been paid in full!) I went back over to the office and after much ado they faxed a letter to my bank telling them to release the second lien on my account. You would think that we could get on with our vacation at this point, right? I mean, I've already had to fight for a (partial...) refund on a room that I literally spent 6 hours in, had to have a second charge removed for failing to show up when I did... But NO... Now a few days later, I call my bank only to find out that they charged my account again for $532. So I go back to the hotel, talk to the manager on duty who informs me that even though I am showing him a statement from my bank with they have taken over $1150 dollars from my account (on two separate occasions), that it is my bank holding the money, not them. He than threatened to call the sheriffs office on me if I didn't leave. This may have been in part to him also dealing with at least three other irate customers at the same time. I left, only to go back the following day, talk to the manager on duty and a very sweet SMART young lady who was able to understand it all and refund me ALL of the money owed to me. While my distress was somewhat diminished by the favorable outcome and the reimbursement of all the money (including the night we stayed and the night we left), I still think that people should be forewarned that this place is a nightmare! We ended up staying at a suite at the Quality Inn next door, same ammenities and a happy hour every night, for the same price as Celebrations Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room for a fair price...”
Reviews.Author: luvicing69
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the room and service that I received from at the Celebration Suites in Kissimmee. I remember visiting Old Town as a kid and staying at the Celebration Suites (it was known then as the Days Suites) with my family. It brought back a lot of good memories. I was here for work, but I defiantly plan to come back soon with my family to visit Central Florida and we will be staying at the Celebration Suites to enjoy all of what this Hotel has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Foreveryoung1968
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Celebration Suites in August 2010 for 11 nights. I will sum it up as follows: Positive  The hotel provides good value for money. Basically you get what you pay for.  Excellent location for evening entertainment in Old Town  Easy access to restaurants  Rooms clean but outdated so can put you off if you are not used to staying in a 2 star hotel Large rooms  Swimming Pool was okay  Reception area nice  Free Parking on site  Beds comfortable  Cleaners do a good job  Hotel staff average Negative  Whilst the hotel is in a prime location the facilities are in need of upgrading. We stayed in one of the newer suite Block D, so we were told. The room was clean but needed updating. The TV is old and outdated. My kids were unable to connect their Xbox as the TV was too old (However you get what you pay for. If you want the Marriott’s you have to pay more)  Free Shuttle to Universal picks you up at 7:55am and departs Universal at 7:15pm. If you want to travel at any other time you have to make your own way.  Breakfast is very basic and limited. – Not continental  Poor Air conditioning  Bed lining very off putting but clean Tips  Best to have your own transportation, as travelling around in Taxi’s can be very expensive. Whilst the bus runs frequently you have to take more than one bus if you want to get to the mall or shopping outlet  Try not to use the Internet in the reception, as it can be very expensive. There is an Internet café about 5 minutes away near. Free wi-fi is available in Denny’s and Macdonald Suggestion for Management  Being in an excellent location you should spend more on upgrading the facilities and décor of the building even if you have to reflect this in the price  Offer free Wi-fi  Invest in some decent bed lining and carpeting – brown can be very off putting and looks cheap  Get your staff to take responsibility when things go wrong. I would recommend this hotel but remember you get what you pay for - basic

Reviews.Title: “I suppose you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: TICouple
Reviews.Content: As the title says, I suppose you get what you pay for.. Ill start with.. THE GOOD The suites are huge. The location is very convenient, right next to Old Town, every major attraction is close, plenty of shopping, etc, etc. The AC in our room was cold, almost to cold, but i wont complain about that.. Dog friendly. ( I wont stay anywhere that isnt ) Inexpensive THE BAD The $5 resort fee truly is a scam.. Why do I have to pay $5 extra ? Dont I pay enough for the room as it is with all the other additional taxes and fees ? I pre paid $5 a day for the continental breakfast for my wife and I.. The first day I went to the room where they have it, there is a picture on the door that says it is $1.50 per person. So because I prepaid, I am loosing out on $2 a day ? I thought the point of pre paying was to SAVE money, not loose it.. While I am on the topic of the breakfast. It is one of the worst I have ever eaten. Here are your choices.. Oranges, coffee, oatmeal, hot chocolate... AND behind the counter they have rice krispy squares, juice boxes, pop tarts, granola bars.. WTF kind of breakfast is that ? The internet is $5 bucks a day or $12 for the week.. In this day, people should NOT haveto pay for internet service while staying at a hotel. While I found that the internet service was fast every time I used it, I shouldnt have had to pay for it.. The first room we had, the back door didnt lock.. I went straight back to the front desk and asked to be switched to a different room, which they did.. I didnt like the fact that I had to go to the front desk everyday to get a gym key.. I sdhould have been able to use my room key.. The gym.. While I dont expect a golds gym, a few more pieces of equipment would have been nice.. I would have also apprecioated some cleaner to wipe off the equipment after I used it and sweated on it.. Paper towels and cleaners would be nice in there.. A bathroom would be great also.. Towels would be great.. The rooms are extremly outdated.. I am not lying here when I say this, that our tv had to of been from 1980, at least ! The bed was comfy, although the floors were stained in a few places.. Now, with all that beind said.. This was an inexpensive place to stay. Itserved its purpose for us and I supposed my bads were nit picky. We are not upity up people.. we do not need fancy smancy. If you are looking for no frills, place to sleep kind of place, this would be it.. It is NOT a fancy place by any means..

Reviews.Title: “Lousy stay”
Reviews.Author: 1funstlman
Reviews.Content: Although the size of the suite was big, I felt like i was stayin in a room from back in the 60's. Internet service was lousy, out of the 3 days i stayed i only picked it up for like 30 minutes of the time in the room. A/c made loud noises, and in bathtub it was leakin from spout all the time. The furniture was scary to even sit on . First nite was on a Saturday night and i couldnt find parking close to building at all. Felt very unsafe, with poor lighting. Other then that , the front desk was professional except for dealin with a wifi complaint, and the room i stayed in was big.

Reviews.Title: “Would prefer not to stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: guynextdoorfl
Reviews.Content: Pros: Spacious, Exterior porch or balcony, close to Publix (Grocery Store), close to Old Town (Tourist Amusement Park), very good location. New beds. Spacious, Spacious, Spacious! I figured it would fit 10 people (with a double sized air mattress) Cons: Air Conditioner did not work efficiently in the living room, very uncomfortable sofa, plenty of stains on the chairs provided, rust around the windows and door. Musty smell in the kitchen, styrofoam cups were left on the counter (no wrapping, just open), microwave did not work. Bathroom right off the kitchen. Bedroom only had small beds, barely enough to fit 2 people (but can). History We purchased this suites off hotwire for around 40 bucks. I loved the proximity to a small amusement park, but it also was bad for traffic on the road around the hotel. We were going to Disney, so we were not interested in the next door amusement park. The parking lot was lit, but not at all that well. It made seeing pedestrians difficult. The hallways are no different, very dimly lit, and had an odor problem. I could hear everything going on the the rooms since the windows were paper thin. Upon entering, we discovered there was no internal only door lock. The room has a musty smell and the walls overall seemed dirty. The dirty feeling followed throughout the whole place. Summary: I didn't feel safe, I didn't feel clean. Sure, the price is great (sleeps family of 4 with different beds, or 2 families at $20 per family) but it doesn't matter if I don't feel safe or clean. For those who like space, this is your place! (but be prepared to bring lots of bleach and your own sheets, plates, silverware, pillows...etc)

Reviews.Title: “Great location,great price, needs updated.”
Reviews.Author: tooly55
Reviews.Content: Me and my family have stayed here 3 times for around 10 nights each time.The location could not be better. As well as th price.the rooms are very big and the cleaning staff very friendly and pollite.the pool was clean & nice. We went to a different hotel this year paid more but the rooms were a lot nicer. the last time we stayed here they were working on the hotel and making improvements. we went over to see and were pleased with the outside apperance they have done a lot did not see inside. Now on the flipside. the last time we staye we reserved a poolside room and did not get it. the front desk man who said he was the front desk manager was very rude. He had no desire to fix any issues we had he just shrugged them off. After seeing the improvements to the outside we will give them another chance and plan to stay there in may 2011. Excited to see the inside. P.S. If you decide to stay there I recommend building D .

Reviews.Title: “More for the $$$”
Reviews.Author: dorcapensacola
Reviews.Content: Affordable, ask for lindi she will make u feel like a tourist, I stay every year, safe, fun, comfy

Reviews.Title: “Awesome - loved our stay at Celebration Suites”
Reviews.Author: mpanawala
Reviews.Content: We loved our 4 night stay at Celebration Suites. I've stayed in a lot of hotels and am pretty picky. Celebration Suites was an excellent value. Rooms were big, super comfortable, very clean and service was awesome. Next time we're visiting attractions in the area, we are definitely staying at Celebration Suites.

Reviews.Title: “hotel great place lot of space for families”
Reviews.Author: kflood10
Reviews.Content: hotel has a lot of space right next plenty of resturants next door to old town place very clean service . very good for families price very it felt just like home.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal & location!”
Reviews.Author: MWINLR
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very large with all the amenities you need. They even accept pets for a very small daily fee! My daughter & I felt quite safe traveling alone & staying here. The pools are large, the staff is very friendly & helpful. My only complaint was that the beds were hard & the remote didn't work for the tv. You can walk to Old Town for shopping, dining & entertainment & a short drive to the theme parks. Best place around for large families or people traveling with pets!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome digs for active teens & pre-teens”
Reviews.Author: LizNwpb
Reviews.Content: This place is located in the heart of "Old Town" where you can watch the carnival images of neon ferris wheels and mechanical swings right from your balcony. The kids can literally walk next door to the carnival and buy tickets for $1 (usually takes several per ride), eat funnel cake and meander through stores right off a 1940's reel-to-reel. There is a LINKS stop right in front that takes you to most other tourist spots. With a car, it is minutes to the "big parks" as well as other fun spots that garner less attention: Ripleys, Wonderworks, Arabian Nights. The staff is always friendly and full of suggestions about what to do for 2hours, 4 hours or the whole day. There are several restaurant menus in the room that deliver right to you and a full-size refrigerator and microwave seem standard in the rooms. Lots of other amenities we didn't try--a gym, business center and pool. It may not be the place you reserve for a "romantic getaway" but anyone looking for lots of room (we had a king-size bedroom, kitchen and sitting room with Murphy bed AND fold-out sofa) and central location to enjoy the magic of this town should consider this place first. Our family loved it.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst place I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: fowerpower
Reviews.Content: This was one of the worst place I have ever stayed. They have a kitchen , but no dishes or pot and pans. Took a showers and the water would not shut off. The room were filthy. the location was good, but everything else about this place was just plain nasty.

Reviews.Title: “A little rough around the edges!”
Reviews.Author: RockmanGalway
Reviews.Content: As part of a 3 week Florida road trip, we stayed here for 6 nights and had an enjoyable time. However, we got off to a very bad start. On checking in, a guest was in front of me with a list of complaints was shouting at the poor receptionist - I felt very sorry for her. It took me about 50 minutes to check in as room was not ready. I requested a pool view suite (handy for kids) and was given one. I was then told the pool was closed and to use one across the street. Our suite was a good size but old - beds were good though . Kitchen was clean but needed to be replaced - fridge had rust inside. There were no plates, pots, flatware in the kitchen and it took us 2 days to get some (long and painful story) The suite has a large balcony but there are no chairs or tables and the floor of it is unpainted and has just dirty greay concrete. A little work her would make a huge difference. There are 2 aircon units and these "just about" keep things cool enough. After a few days we settled in and thing improved - pool opened up - they even provided pool towels! Pool was clened regularily. However, our room was only cleaned by the maid twice in 6 days. In summary, when you first get there, the complex may remind you of a prison! It is not beautiful. However, we enjoyed our time there.The staff were friendly, security good & location great.

Reviews.Title: “Wasnt bad”
Reviews.Author: Disnneyfan2
Reviews.Content: When we first got to the hotel we were able to check in 2 hours early without paying extra. When we got to the room the air condition in the front room wasn't working but the maintenance men came quickly to replace it. It was still hot but it was better then nothing. There weren't any bugs at all and clean. The refrigerator didn't keep the drinks super cold but it could have been from how hot it is. Also you have to rent the dishes which is only 4 dollars a night and thats for 6 people which isn't bad at all. We traveled with 4 adults, 1 teenager and 1 baby and there were plenty of space for everyone and my son had tons of room to run and play. Next time we go to old town we are staying here.

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUGS IN ROOM 1238 & We have the bites & pics to prove it”
Reviews.Author: luvmahumma
Reviews.Content: I checked out of this hotel this am 07/30/2010. While gathering our belongings I noticed several bugs crawling on the BED!!!!! OMG when I pulled back the sheets, 8-15 bugs were crawling on the bed. Thank God!!! no one had slept in that particular bed last night. On the 10 hour drive home I noticed bites all over my arms, and the numbers continue to increase. Being a nurse I realized these are BLOOD-SUCKING VECTORS that can spread infectious diseases!!!! sure that last hotel guest that slept in that bed did not have hepatitis or AIDS............. The beds & room may have a BED BUG INFESTION Be sure to check out the picture I am posting..... Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't ever stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: Monica2204
Reviews.Content: When you arrive at the check in desk, it looks very nice with a big flat screen tv showing the amenities. Then... the pros - the staff is friendly. Cons - you have to pay a daily rate for the internet, be sure to pack pots, pans & utensils, because they charge a daily rate for those, too. The rooms have an odd odor, the rooms are very, very old. Needs major upgrades. Rust in fridge. There isn't a tv station guide. If you want an iron you have to sign one out at the front desk, then they charge your credit card 20.00 for the iron. The 20.00 is refunded when you sign back in the iron. The pool is listed as an amenity but your charged $24.75 when you check out for those (even, as in my case, if you never used them!!) In conclusion, DON'T STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: mgort74
Reviews.Content: i have recently stayed at Celebration Suites at Old Town. Come to my surprise I was very inpressed by the size of the rooms. They were very comfortable and clean, the customer service met all of my expextations. My family and I loved this hotel and we are definately staying here when we return in the end of the year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent serivce”
Reviews.Author: Meganmerchant
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at celebration suites years ago and we loved it so much that we have decided to take our family back to stay there again!!!The service there is great!!! We are going there again in December\2010 and they have offered us free breakfast for everyday of our stay!!!!!!!! Thanks, FromThe Merchant family (St.George N.B Canada)

Reviews.Title: “Needs more upgrades”
Reviews.Author: pulley1
Reviews.Content: I will start this review by saying I have not stayed at the Celebration suites in over 2 years and felt with all the decent reviews and ads about their "upgrades", I figured we would give it another try, after deciding to spend the weekend in Kissimmee. Their were 5 people in my party, with 1 of them being a 3 year old. When we checked, we were told we were being given one of the upgraded suites, for no additional charge ( normally it is an additional $20 a night), which was awesome we thought. Unfortunately, the only thing that was upgraded in our suite, was the mattresses, doors and the new paint job. The negatives: The sinks were huge, but the faucets were small and required your hands to constantly hit the sink, because there was no real room between the water coming from the faucet and the edge of the sink. Our bathroom sink and bath faucet leaked and the sink had no hot water. The floors were dirty and there was no real water pressure in the shower. In the kitchen, there was no hot water in the kitchen sink and there was no water pressure. How can one wash any dishes when they are there. There was no ice tray or ice maker in the freezer, and the ice machine, didn't work for us. Be sure to bring your own plates and utensils, or you will have to pay for them while you are there. And the hood in the kitchen, which one would use when using the 2 top burner stove top, was disgusting and had not been cleaned in awhile. And then there is the bug issue, I realize it is Florida and roaches happen, they can enter to room at any point, but we found 1 roach in the kitchen, which could have been caused by the large crack between the door and the door frame. Plus right outside our room, there were wasps everywhere, we had to dart inside to avoid them. The only other negative, that I don't know how the hotel could really control, was the noise levels of the other guests. We were on the first floor and had the people above us, running and jumping all through there room late at night, and there were guest (teens), running through the hallways yelling and screaming at all hours of the night. Maybe a little security or someone monitoring the hallways at night could stop this, it seems to happen anytime we have stayed there. And the positives: It is cheap, can't go wrong with $55 a night, for a suite that sleeps 6 The new playground area, my child loved it. The exterior of the building has been painted and looked wonderful The closeness to Old Towne and the wonderful restaurants nearby was great. I highly recommend Tex Mex and Flippers We complained to the hotel staff when we checked out and the person at the desk gave us a coffee mug with candy and business cards, she could have cared less about anything. This really didn't help make things any better. Unless we need a cheap hotel to stay at, I don't think we will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, convenience and outstanding service from A-Z!”
Reviews.Author: edlunt
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this location for almost 25 years now. We have never been disappointed and when we plan a trip to Disney or otherwise we always choose Celebration Suites (Formerly Days Inn and Suites) for our lodging. The price is right, the location is perfect and the service is always friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Vacation”
Reviews.Author: sarahperez
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for a large family with lots of space. The rooms are very comfortable with plenty of room for relaxing after long days at the theme parks. The kitchen is very clean, accomodating and makes it easy to cook and save money on restaraunts. The location was perfect for my family because it is right next door to Old Towne, so you could walk there and not worry about parking. The pools are clean and close to the rooms. I have been staying at this hotel for many years and I will continue to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap spacious with a motel feel”
Reviews.Author: Zteam4
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading all the great reviews. The hotel was great for our budget. Although it was clean the rooms were extemely old. It gave us the motel feeling instead of the hotel/suites feeling. The remotes did not work, the murphy bed had a lot of trash behind it, the toilet was dirty, the internet connection is horrible and the fixtures were rusty. If you are ok with rust and want something cheap for your family stay. It was clean and the pools were nice. We saved money and only came to our room to sleep and eat.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tecomagirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in September 2009, I couldn't be happier with the room or the service, I had travelled from Australia on my own and once the staff knew this they went out of their way to make me feel very welcome and accomodated me in any way they could. I felt safe staying at Celebration Suites and being able to hop on the shuttle bus to the theme parks was also a bonus. I am hoping to return in 2011 and will be staying at Celebration Suites again, certainly value for money. A big thank you to all the staff

Reviews.Title: “I did NOT like the stay.”
Reviews.Author: tl1428
Reviews.Content: The positive - very friendly housekeeping staff. The negatives - blood specks on the shower wall, dirty socks behind the murphy bed, dirty toilets and burnt out light bulbs all at check-in, roaches under the kitchen sink, stains and lint/knit balls on the suite furniture, too small bath towels, non-working tv remotes, rusted refridgerators, balcony doors that don't lock and 1 working ice machine for 4 buildings...not to mention, you have to pay for (rent) the use of an iron!!! Thankful that the motel-like stay wasn't enough to ruin my trip.I always enjoy Florida, just DID NOT enjoy, feel comfortable in, or like in the least my stay @ Celebration Suites. I do not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay. It felt like being at home.”
Reviews.Author: grandma34293
Reviews.Content: Our visit was enjoyable. The location was close to all of the attractions we where visiting. We felt comfortable and relaxed as if we were at home. The facility met all of our needs and the staff was helpful and pleasant. This was our fourth visit and we plan on staying here when we return to this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay !!! keep going back.”
Reviews.Author: JAFFscotlandUK
Reviews.Content: We love staying at the suites for many reasons being that the staffs are friendly and the accommodation is fantastic. The location is brilliant really close to Disney and not long to get to Universal Studios and SeaWorld. There are lots of places to eat nearby also. But what I lover about this place is it is right next door to OLD TOWN. My most favourite place in the world :-). The suites just fab since being refurbished a lot of hard work has gone in to making the place look fab. Thanks again Celebration Suites can’t wait to come back. Jaff and Family.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bascha007
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times. The staff are friendly and it's great to be able to have room when you travel with children. Seperate sleeping quarters is a plus. Great room for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value / Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jeff1128
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Celebration Suites many times since the early 90s. I have always enjoyed my stays and look forward to returning again soon. The value offered by the Celebration Suites is incredible. The accommodations are spacious and comfortable including a large kitchen with a microwave, cook top and full size refrigerator/freezer. The location is great with a close proximity to all of Orlando’s major theme parks. Being right next door to Old Town’s shops and restaurants is an added bonus. I have traveled both with family and friends and everyone has thoroughly enjoyed their stays.

Reviews.Title: “4 generations: great set-up”
Reviews.Author: cfranklin541
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the pleasant, friendly, and helpful staff. Location has easy access to main highways. Kitchen set-up is great for families with kids. We used the ice machine, pool, game room, and the laundromat.

Reviews.Title: “great quality, great location”
Reviews.Author: nykoleareas
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very spacious especially if traveling with a large group. rooms were very clean. the location of the hotel is great, right across the street from old town, great touristy place! would definitely go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but hotel itself is runned down.”
Reviews.Author: workinggirl21
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to all the major attractions which was a bonus, plus it was cheaper than staying in Orlando. The reason why this place is so cheap though is because they charge money for every little thing. This is the first place I've been to that charged money to use their dishes and utensils. Breakfast was $1.50 which I find very cheap but it's funny that they would charge for it when most hotels provided it for free. They had swimming pools but these were old and dirty. The hotel and rooms were all a little bit outdated. We spent most of our time at the parks so the room served it's purpose. This place is alright but I wouldn't recommend it for an extended stay. I also found the atmosphere to not be that safe. One night while we were there my brother and I got chased by some guy with no shoes and we ran to the main lobby, so be forewarned, don't let children wander around unattended.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect place!”
Reviews.Author: johele
Reviews.Content: You won't find a better deal; YOU WILL LOVE: THE PLACE, THE PRICE AND LOCATION! I have tried so many hotels in the area, i've done those deals of time share and all, but never again! What they called "suites" is a couch in a room.Go to Celebration Suites and you will know what a "suite" should be; real living room, real kitchen, full size refregirator, real table and chairs, and another doorway to get in the bedroom. NOW you have a suite. So much room, it's perfect knowing you can sleep 6 people no problem. It is very close to interstate , easy to find,(Disney is on the same road) many pools, and next to it (litterally walk across a back road) is the perfect entertainment for ALL ages: Old Town . Everybody i have taken there will return, everybody i have sent will return. You will never go anywhere else again!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!!!”
Reviews.Author: CoastalChickenPotPie
Reviews.Content: Hubby, friend and myself stayed in the newer suites and enjoyed our time very much. Since we only paid about $35 a night we really couldn't complain about the few minor inconveniences we came across in the week we were there. Here is the upside of the motel: 1. It has free shuttles that are available to and from the parks (Disneyworld/ Universal/ Sea World). You'll want to use the shuttles as you are far from Disney and super far from Universal and Sea World. Taxis are outrageous and not worth it. 2. You get lots of space in each suite. We found plenty of room with staying with our friend and never felt cramped. 3. You get a fridge to store food in. This is a bonus if you want to keep dairy products or snacks. There is a Publix across the street and it is easily accessible. Can end up saving a lot by using the kitchen. Note: You have to pay for any pots/ pans/ silverware. What we ended up doing was, taking extra plastics when we were eating out in Disney. Just grab a bunch of forks and spoons- SO MUCH CHEAPER!!!! 4. No extra fees like some other reviews had written of. I checked with the guy upon leaving and was like, "So nothing extra is going to show up on my VISA now like some other people have warned!?!?". He said no, but he also added, "I hope not!" So, take it for what it was. Thus far, no extra charges! :) Some of the minor inconveniences: 1. Television remotes did not work. This is minor so we did not really care. We rarely watched any television on our trip and it was a bit annoying that anytime we wanted to change the volume/ channel, we had to get up and do so. A reminder to be thankful for modern conveniences back home eh!?!? :) 2. The water pressure is terrible. I think they have gone more green to make it efficient. It's just hard to enjoy the medium heated shower when it has such weak pressure. Not a big deal for us though. 3. The shuttle times and drivers are to be desired. I think they don't like their jobs so they are somewhat short with people and indirect. We had two of them tell us that they didn't drive to Celebration at Old Town and we had been taking the shuttle with them for three or four days. After telling them exactly where we were staying, the one guy was like, "Oh yeah, I go there!!!" Of course you do- we knew you did!!!! Plus, the times are like 6 pm, or 10 pm and anytime you go, it'll be super busy and the bus will be packed! So, just hope you can get on quickly and sit down. Too bad they did not have an 8pm pickup time in there to break it up. Also, the earliest time you can go is 10 am and it takes at least 20 minutes to get there. It'd be nice if they had another early pickup time. Thankfully they make three trips in the morning as well. We got what we paid for and were pleased with it. We didn't pay a lot and we did not have high expectations. It's great and cheap if you are traveling on the cheap side. If you are not looking for cheap, this may not be right for you. I've stayed worse places so I cannot really complain. It was comfortable for us and we enjoyed ourselves and I can confidently recommend it, but make sure you get the updated suites that are close to reception! :)

Reviews.Title: “NO PREVIEW - NO STAY”
Reviews.Author: OFFAGAINMOMME
Reviews.Content: My mother and I travel to Orlando at least once a month and stay at the same hotel each time. I thought I would like to try another motel and decided to check out Celebration Suites. BAD idea. I walked in and asked to see one of the room as I don’t stay anyplace I can’t preview the accommodations. I have NEVER been refused a review of any room EXCEPT at Celebration. I could not believe it when they said “we don’t allow any preview of our rooms we have them showing on the screen in the lobby so you can see what they look like”. I informed her that the rooms always look good on web pages and TV screen but are often far different in person. Consequently, we will not be staying there. NO PREVIEW - NO STAY.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: AbuSeena
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean, economic place to stay near Disney then this is it. The room rates are awesome and the rooms are large, clean with amenities like refrigerator and microwave. We stayed here for about a week and made our own breakfast everyday before heading over to the parks. Saved us a ton of money and time. The grocery store is also within walking distance and many places to eat nearby. A shuttle is available to take the guests to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel at Great Location...”
Reviews.Author: TDOH2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 days. Rooms were spacious and clean. Staff was courteous and went out of their ways to help us. The old town carnival was next door to the suite which was very convenient. Overall, big thumbs up!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Accomidation”
Reviews.Author: suzyQBmth
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 15days. When I first saw the buildings I thought they looked a little dated & I wondered what I had let myself in for. On entering the suite I was very pleasently suprised. It was very clean & well laid out. The bed was huge(kingsize) & the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. There was sitting room containing armchairs, TV, Settee(maybe pull-out-bed, I never used), a pull down double bed & coffee table, Kitchen had fridge freezer ( good size freezer compartment), microwave, hob & coffee perculator. No utensils at all!! It costs $4 per day or $15 per week to hire these, so bring your own IF you can. Toast, Kettle etc also for hire. Freezer broke down, it was replaced promtly, but not before I lost over $20 in food (I was never offered compensation). Bedroom has washbasin, wardrobe, TV, bed, etc. Bathroom as expected, Towels a bit on the small size, but plenty of them for just me. Balconies etc have no furniture, so they are useless. The rooms were cleaned daily & I found the staff friendly. Pools were small, but ment they heated up nicely & there are barbeques nearby. Warning if you want to use there computers its 50c per min. Ouch!! My suite was right by the Old Town, they shut at 11pm & the noise was not bad most of the time. I found the hotel was in an ideal postion being next to The Old Town & Hot Spot amusement park. No unexpected bill at the end of my stay, unlike metioned on some reviews. Free safe!! Plenty of resturants & gift shops nearby & on the 55 &56 Lynx bus route. Get a weekly pass(not easy to come by) $16 for unlimited travel, otherwise $2 per trip (including transfers) or $4.50 per day. No.56 takes you to Disney Tranfer terminal every 30mins, Journey takes about 20mins, Universal is about 3 bus rides away!! I didn't try free shuttle. Good, cheap place to get Disney tickets is Booth across the road, between Ponderosa Resturant & gift shop. I got 4day Disney Hopper for $180! Another booth I got Gatorland tickets for $17. Tip- If you like your tea bring your own, American tea is awful & $20 for 160 box of PG Tips IF you can find them!!

Reviews.Title: “ROACHES!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: laflaca0225
Reviews.Content: If you like living with ROACHES this is the place for you. The hotel room was big, comfortable beds, clean and the pools were great the rooms were infested with ROACHES. We had two seperate rooms and both rooms had ROACHES. I also asked some people at the pool if their rooms had ROACHES and they all said YES!!. We ordered pizza and chicken wigs one day and left the rest in the box for about an hour before putting it in the fridge and when I looked inside the box it was full of ROACHES. We had to keep everything in the refrigerator even the paper plates, napkins and utensils. DO NOT LEAVE ANYTHING OUTSIDE. The bathroom was also full of ROACHES. I will never stay there again even if it's for free.

Reviews.Title: “Upset Florida Resident”
Reviews.Author: yhannon
Reviews.Content: I checked into our Celebration Suites & found out we were too early. I was assigned a room and explained I wanted to pay cash. I was told when I came back to check in at 4pm I could pay then. My family and I returned and I explained I wanted to pay cash for my room. Next to me there was a man who was complaining that he wanted to be on the east side and was given a room on the west side. So his desk clerk gave him our room. My desk clerk said oh you just gave away my room and she said 'Yeah I did!' First of all. I do not think this was fair since I had already been there earlier and assigned this room. My family and I ended up going from being assigned to building B to a room in the back, 2 streets away to building O. Buildings A-G have recently been remodeled and we were put into an area comparitable to the projects. The front room's air did not work. The room was old and outdated and the pool did not work. What kind of vacation is this. We live in Florida and we have been going to Old Town for years, this has definetly put a damper on visiting again. BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: “It's ok”
Reviews.Author: rlptf
Reviews.Content: Celebration Suites was an ok hotel to stay at. One of the good things was the size of the room it had one bedroom that slept 4 and the living room had a murphy bed that slept 2. Another good thing was it had a kitchen. The location is a plus right next door to Old Town and other attractions and close to Disney. The things we did not like was you had to put a deposit on things like the iron & ironing board and the pots, pans and dishes for the kitchen. The thing I did not like the most was having to go to the lobby to access the internet and you had to pay for the continental breakfast. The pool in our area was supposed to be heated but did not feel like it. The staff was very nice and we would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No Air Conditioning”
Reviews.Author: slmathis
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel for the location. The air conditioning did not cool in our first room. The staff moved us. No help moving our belongings, but the next room did seem better....UNTIL that air conditioning unit gave out at 3 in the morning. DO NOT STAY HERE if you like to be cool at night. The staff vvas friendly but did not fix the situtation. Terrrible nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Suite - Great Location - Great Value - What more do you want??”
Reviews.Author: DenSue_10
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews we had resevations about booking this accomodation, but as it has such a great location we decided to take a chance and are we glad we did. On first arrival you can see that there has been a huge effort and investment in upgrading the site and rooms. The new management certainly try to pull out all the stops to make the experience as pleasurable as possible. We stayed for 8 nights and enjoyed every aspect of this great accomodation. Staff were courteous, the rooms were comfortable - especially the bed!! - and spacious with separate lounge, diner / kitchen and sleeping areas. We would certainly recommend this place for short or long stays. Old Town is 2 minutes walk away and lets you relax after spending a day at the attrations which are only 10 minutes drive. Den & Sue - Cleveland UK

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds, clean, good service, courteous staff, had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: tinselt33
Reviews.Content: Although this isn't the Taj Mahal of accomodations, it was clean, the beds were very comfortable, (something we don't often get in hotel rooms), rates were reasonable, and the location is central to everything. We were there for 12 days and having this 1 bedroom suite, sure made it more homey than being cooped up in one room without any amenities. The separate bedroom with its' own TV gave us room to move around without breathing down each other's throats all the time. There are two very nice pools that are well maintained and supposedly heated, although they were cold all the time we were there. Laundry facilities are available, clean, new machines, and are well maintained. Wireless internet is available in the lobby, but not to the units, which was an inconvenience. I understand though, that they are upgrading their system so that the internet will be available in all the units. The attractions at Old Town are right along side of the complex and there is some noise, but it does all shut down at 11 p.m. so not a problem. We are hoping to return again next year and will certainly stay at Celebration Suites again..

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay, quiet, convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Angels2js
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay. Reserved a suite for 4 nights @ $79.95. Very reasonable. Enjoyed the kitchen in the room and the WiFi. Had to go through an "act of congress" to get service.

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean and helpful and friendly staff. Good location for Disney Parks”
Reviews.Author: DonaldFamily
Reviews.Content: We were a bit apprehensive from past reviews but the Celebration Suites were great. We arrived late at 10.30pm to friendly staff , very helpful. The rooms were spacious and extremely clean, We had a room overlooking the pool and heard no noise from the pool. The Suites were well located for supermarket Publix and restaurants. If we didn't take the courtesy bus we took the LINX bus to to the trasnportation centre which was a good half hourly service. We also were pleased to be able to pay a small fee on the last day to keep the room, for a few extra hours, before we flew home in the evening. We will definately stay in the Celebration Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “When in Kissimmee this is the only place I stay”
Reviews.Author: Nena2six
Reviews.Content: I stay in Kissimmee anywheres between 15-20 times a year. I choose the suites because of the friendlyness, cleanliness, proximity to Old Town and the price. I have found over time it is well worth the little extra to get the supreme rooms do to the locations of the buildings (these are closer to Old Town). I recentlly found that for $20 more I can do early check-in, this is a little pricey but, I'm willing to pay it because I usually leave straight from night shift to go to Kissimmee, this way I can check in early and get a little snooze time in before the family shows up later. Yes, you can find cheper prices around the area but, I go to Kissimmee for Old Town and Celebration Suites suits my every need. Throughout my past couple of years of staying there I've run into minor problems, door key doesn't work, refridgerator leaking, toilet stopped up BUT considering I've only mentioned three things over several years and two of the things (refridgerator and toilet) happened before new renovations, I'm batting 100% satisfaction. And all three things were handled immediatelly plus very professionally. As you can see this is not a one nighter review, I am a routine guest and will continue to be a routine guest at Celebration Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Very good "bang for buck"”
Reviews.Author: ahmedrahim00
Reviews.Content: I ofter travel to Orlando for business, and staying at the Celebration Suites this time was a pleasant surprise. After staying for the two nights I was there, the price really stood out in my mind for the level of service I had received from the staff as well as the just the presentation of the room. I travel every week, and I would definitely stay here the next time I have to come to Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay for the money”
Reviews.Author: uzcam
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel for the price, we traveled all the way in 2007 so some things could had change since then. There were 7 of us in total, 3 adults, 2 teens, 1 toddlers & an infant. The room had 2 queens beds and a pull out bed. We took the playpen for the baby. The room is spacious but there is only 1 bathroom (small) and it was hard for everyone to use it. The kitchen has a fullsize fridge and 2 burning stoves. The kitchen doesn't come with pots or pans or anything you will need, you can rent for like $15 for the stay and they will give you everything you need (plates, pots, silverware, etc). We liked the place cause 1st, the kitchen is so nice when you have little kids and to save money cooking meals rather then eating all 3 meals outside. Spacious, room for everyone. What we didn't like its that the stove is not ment to cook real food meals, example: We tried to make chiken one day and its took sooooo long to cook and the pots are so crapy that everything sticks to them. But other then that it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff - Big Clean Rooms - Best place for the money!”
Reviews.Author: tvoytko
Reviews.Content: I came down with a family of 5 for a weekend at Disney's Epcot. Location was great! Right next to Old Town, just a stone throw away from a Target and in Kissimmee, so every type of food imaginable was right there close. The room was clean and the staff was nice. - The only down side I had was the bathroom sink did not drain the entire visit. I didn't let them know about the problem until I checked out (there was another bathroom style sink in another part of the suite and the kitchen sink that worked just fine). -- One important note - I never heard a sound out of any of the other guests the entire time I was there. I was poolside, and I could see many people using the clean pool, but I never heard a peep of noise - If you are on a tight budget and you have a large group, this is the best choice I found!

Reviews.Title: “The rudest staff I've encountered”
Reviews.Author: scottyreynolds
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this short. I booked the hotel with one credit card and before arriving, decided to use a different account to pay for the trip. I transferred my money to that account and upon checking in, gave the front desk the new card. I also informed them that it was different than the one I booked with. They made an imprint of the new card and I signed a form with the new card number on there. My family and I then left for Downtown Disney. When we arrived back, my kids had just laid down when someone started banging on the door. I refused to open the door until the man identified himself. At first he refused, but when I threatened to call the police if he didn't leave, he identified himself as hotel security and told me I needed to go to the front desk immediately. My wife and daughters were very frightened by this to say the least. I changed out of my pjs and went to the front desk only to be met by another rude employee who informed me loudly in front of other guests and staff that my card was declined. I told her that was impossible and she shoved a piece of paper at me and still in a loud tone asked me if that was my card number or not. When I told her that was not the card they took the imprint of nor the card I signed for, she didn't change her attitude, but did run the correct card and it went through fine No apology for frightening my family, no apology for the rude treatment. Stay far away from this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not so good , not that bad...”
Reviews.Author: boomboomgaby
Reviews.Content: ok , we go by parts 1) location ok , publix , walgreens and a lot of cheap shopping..ok 2) rooms ok , little bit old but no problems at all !!!!(always talking about superior room) 3) housekeeping , actually very good 4) be aware they give you the kitchen, but not the stuff ,so you have to rent it from them (dishes knife forks etc) for this will coast you 5 uss a day ,but if you need toaster you have to pay and extra 2 uss or something like this.... 5) the reception was good except when i rent the kitchen stuff i have to carry this big box to my room(50 meters) !!!! after this very nice people 6) amenities : the swimig pool looks so good but my stay was cold , didnt use it and the loundry was out of service (but they told me to go to the other wing ,there was working ( i didnt even try) and for wireless internet you have to pay extra !!! and finishing my review : they charge you room + osceola tax + florida tax + resort fee +sale tax : example they said 64 and by the end its 84 or something like this a little bit old but i can recomend it !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The title of the hotel is the truth”
Reviews.Author: hew076
Reviews.Content: This past weekend myself, my boyfriend, and 5 of our friends stayed at the comfort suites in kissimee. We chose this hotel because it was right next to old town (something we were planning on doing) and the price was right. The seven of us stayed in the room and although the one bathroom was kind of cramped nobody felt as though we needed more space. Almost everything about this hotel was enjoyable except for when we ran out of towels we called downstairs to the front desk and asked for two more sets of towels they brought us 2 floor towels that kind of made me upset. But there is no smell, we saw no bugs this place was quite enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth your time. Worst night sleep at a hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: SniderINK
Reviews.Content: I had been to Old Town and I thought it would be awesome to stay so close on our vacation. I couldn't have been wronger. First off we heard that it would be a wiser idea to get the superior hotel room because they where better. HA! When we walked into our room it was very very musty. But at first view it was very clean and very spacious. That was the only and best thing about the hotel that we liked. Not one of the doors worked well. The sliding door stuck something awful and both the front door and the bedroom door you had to slam to get them closed. The tv in the bedroom was extremely dated. Looks like it was from the 80's. Neither tv got good reception either. So much for cable tv. The internet reception was decent so no complaint there. The beds were a nightmare. The worst night sleep I've ever had a hotel. The beds where hard and very uncomfortable. Although I will say it was quiet. You didn't get a lot of distractions from Old Town. This was the first hotel I have ever had to pay for a continental breakfast. Seriously guys? The worst thing by far was how I got treated on our check out day. We opted for a late check out so we had went out for a bit on the town before checking out and we we returned we had been locked out of our room. Both of our keys weren't working. So we went to the office to find out what the heck was going on. Instead of getting I am sorry for the miscommunication or anything. I was rudely told that the card demagnetized and it happens. I have NEVER had a hotel key demagnetize. Then they tried checking me out early, by that point I was so upset that all I could tell him was I wanted my key to work so I could get my things. I also asked that since we were locked out of our room before we were suppose to leave that I wanted them to take off the fee for having a late check out since we were locked out of our room. The declined and admitted no fault to anything wrong with the keys again. We will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Getting better”
Reviews.Author: perarne
Reviews.Content: Ilove this place and they are fixing up the place roomy and close to old town i have come here for over 10 years now and cant wait to visit again

Reviews.Title: “economical but watch out for hidden costs”
Reviews.Author: bjbuddy
Reviews.Content: The website speaks to a full eat in kitchen and mentions the fridge, stove and dishwasher. Depending on which site you visit, you may be unaware that there is an additional charge if you want dishes to use during your stay. I showed the front desk staff the website page that I had relied on (which didn't mention this extra charge) and they did provide the dishes for our stay. The staff were reluctantly accomodating. The room was dated but fairly clean and the housekeeping staff left cute towel art in the bathroom. We didn't have any issues with bugs of any kind, which I understand is a growing problem in the area. The hotel information also says that it is 1.5 miles from the Disney parks so we thought we could walk and not be subject to the restricted times allowed by the shuttle provided by the hotel. It is actually 5.4 miles to the Disney parks- and it costs $25 - $30 to get a cab back to the hotel if you want to return before the shuttle comes. There are a few options with 1 block for full breakfast buffets that are very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: DallasTravelqueen
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at Celebration Suites was an enjoyable experience. The rooms were spacious, and beds were comfortable. The staff was extremely nice and accomodating. What we loved most was how it was conveniently located near Disney. This hotel offers a friendly, clean, convenient place to stay. Overall, we had a great time..

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with the family -Great Value-”
Reviews.Author: MaritaGR
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed with my family (2 adults and 3 children) at the newly renovated "Superior Suites" at Celebration suites @ Old Town and had a very good experience. Suites were very comfortable, spacious and clean. We loved the pretty towel arrangements in the bathroom and room and the fragrance sticks around the suite that gave a very nice touch. Beds were great with comfortable mattresses and nice linens. The kids enjoyed the playground next to our room and the bigger one next to Old Town. Front desk service was very friendly and helpful. We had a heated pool right next to our room (Building D) and a spacious guest’s laundry room. There's a new gym for the guests to enjoy, pantry and playroom. For those who don't know the area I can tell you there are lots of restaurants around, a Publix (grocery store) across the street and 2 amusement parks next door. It's located less than 5 minutes to Disney: location couldn't be better and price is very convenient. We're very glad and will definitely go back again when we go to the Disney Area.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price!”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbellfan
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay for the price! If you are looking for a spacious and affordable place to stay near Disney World this is it. They are located next to the Old Town amusement park and are walking distance from several restaurants and a grocery store. We utilized the hotel's free shuttle service to Disney World and also used the local bus system which saved us from renting a car! They are right by a bus stop. We didn't notice any loud noise from the amusement park like some have mentioned (we stayed there Wed. through Sun.). If you aren't staying on the Disney property, this is a great, affordable alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great people, and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: kerriag
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for a family. We have stayed here plenty of times, and never have had a bad experience. This is not a quiet place....but that's quite obvious if you checked the web site. It is located next door to 2 amusement parks. Old Town is a party place for all ages. It usually quiets down at around midnight. Some of the rooms have been renovated, but if you get one that's older they will give you a better room upon request. The renovated rooms have all new mattresses, bed linens, carpet etc. It is a very old hotel, but most are that are located on HWY 192 Irlo Bronson, "Disney Maingate." This is a favorite with my kids, parents, aunts, cousins....etc. We rather stay here than on Disney grounds because of local restaurants in walking distance, full kitchens, easy access to Disney, or I-4 to Universal Studios....Love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Anniemac13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room at Celebration Suites based on a recommendation from a coworker. When we entered our room there was a foul stench that hit us immediately (a doritos/foot potpourri). The room had not been vacuumed or swept, the counter tops were dirty, the bathtub was covered in soap scum and the bed had a lovely cigarette burn on the comforter. We immediately went to the front desk to cancel our room. The staff member was nothing more than surly and informed us we would be charged for the night. At this point I didn't care, I would rather leave pest-free and clean than stay in that dump for one night. Don't waste your time staying here - disgusting!

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: vetteshow
Reviews.Content: Made reservations for 4 nights and was specifically told I would get one of the newly renovated rooms next to Old Town. When I arrived I was given a room badly in need of renovation on the other side of the road from Old Town. The room was deplorable. The carpet is old, mattresses are flat and sunk in (I refused to sleep between the sheets), the bedspreads must be the original to the room, in my opinion; it is just an old dilapidated facility. Had I know the run down condition of the room I would get, I would have stayed somewhere else. If my family had been with me, I would have been embarrassed to have them stay there. I told them I was amazed they had the nerve to open rooms in such a run down condition to the public. The desk clerk argued that I had not been guaranteed one of the renovated rooms. Believe me I know what I was told when I made reservations. She then offered to adjust the rate, however that would not upgrade the condition of the room. Here are too many other places in that area with comparable rates to stay offering nice accommodations to stay in such a unpleasant environment. BEWARE – DO NOT EXPECT TOO MUCH FROM THIS PLACE – YOU WILL BE DISAPPOINTED – IF YOU STAY THERE AFTER READING THIS – YOU HAVE ONLY YOURSELF TO BLAME!!!!

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay if you are going to Old Town”
Reviews.Author: kayfutrell
Reviews.Content: clean and pleasant and huge rooms..great price...excellent location..i am repeat customer and they always give the room i ask for...this is not the disney expierence...this is the old town hotel..a must stay place if you have teenagers so they can have a great time without the worry..great shopping and eating and drinking and old car shows at old town

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Huge Rooms!!!”
Reviews.Author: SamirLak
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Suites at Old Town was a great experience. We were greeted by wonderful staff and the rooms were very large so we felt like we were right at home. Can't be the location, in the heart of all attractions. I plan to come back and bring my whole family on my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “a vacation home away from home”
Reviews.Author: TravelerForSix
Reviews.Content: My daughter and stayed at the Suites at Old Town and what a great location the property is located, next to Old Town Entertainment park near Sea world, Disney, and the Wide World of Sports!! We were off the main road so we could have quick access to the major road system, restaurants and souvenir shops. The property is going through a renovation and that is a huge positive. We hardly were on property due to the location being in the middle of all the action. Separate rooms that could sleep 6 plus a kitchen -I wish all properties were like that I all tourist towns and vacation spots. I recommend this property and hope you enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Do your self a favor! Please dont stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Gyalgod
Reviews.Content: This ho_tel gives credence to the old adage "you get what you pay for". First off the rooms are old and horrible and could do with a decent scrub down. I don't know what was worse, the blood curdling sounds of the fan in the bathroom (that we called the front office twice about and they never fixed) or the sounds of screaming people and rides from Old Town all night. There should be a fee for the free breakfast, that way people would be more rightfully inclined not to go. I mean if you’re just looking for somewhere cheap and dirty, then this is your place and I mean that literally. Overall, it wasn’t the worse experience I’ve ever had, but by no means one of the more pleasurable experiences either.

Reviews.Title: “would do it again”
Reviews.Author: marynjack
Reviews.Content: We just came back from the suites and i have to tell ya it is worth the money and enjoyment. We have been comming here for years with our daughter and this year she came with her daughter we all enjoyed. Yes the rooms need repair but ya can't beat it. Lots of room for 4 adults and 1 child and 2 dogs.

Reviews.Title: “Repulsive in Every Way Imaginable”
Reviews.Author: elfwhims
Reviews.Content: We wanted the perfect hotel for my son's 8th birthday. The rooms online looked spectacular (room 1229 - don't know the building) and clean and modern. And the rate for what we saw was wonderful, so we all decided to book, looking forward to our trip. When we checked in, we got the shock of our lives. It was nothing like what we'd seen online. The carpet in my room (J-1325) had burn holes in them, the televisions didn't work properly and the bar right outside my back door was a nice touch. Especially the loud bass music that played until 2am. And the fact that my front door didn't close properly was a nice feature too. I would NEVER stay here again, this was not the perfect hotel I had imagined it to be. You would do better to camp out in your car or stay at the local truck stop motel. The matress in the main room was covered in stains...GROSS!! The next room (J-1327) where my parents stayed had a terrible odor that smelled like a cross between dirty feet and bleach! The room number was missing and replaced with masking tape and the room number was written in pencil. The refrigerator had no bar on the door to store food and the stove was disgusting! All of the fixtures in the bathroom were black. The TV in the bedroom didn't work at all either. In room N-1400, where my sister and her family stayed, white paint was covering mold on the ceiling near the kitchen, the wall paper was coming off the walls, and their son's room smelled of must! We had no kitchen utensils (plates, cups, silverware, etc..) so we had to rent them for $5 a day. The bathroom towels were small and as thin as paper. They brought an air purifier with them that they just purchased. After 2 nights of staying here, the filter is now full of dirt and dust!!! We're writing all this because you should now that this is not an isolated incident.. This is a family that stayed in 3 separate rooms in 2 different buildings!! Please do not stay here.. The people are rude and unaccomodating and the place is absolutely unsanitary!! When we first pulled up near building N, the trash was overflowing. We immediately began calling around to other hotels and could not find 3 rooms available. NEVER AGAIN!!! STAY AWAY!!! I am contacting the department of Health and the Better Business Bureau. This place needs to be shut down.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect to us!”
Reviews.Author: dida10
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at lSuites at Old Town on December 2nd/13th, in this year. We like to have breakfast and dinner inside the room, so we bought a lot of food and put in the refrigerator, that is big. The hotel is located at Old Town, that is a lovely place, with many restaurants and atractions, we loved it! I recommend to watch, on wednesdays, Dwigthy Icenhower, who is a perfect "Elvis Presley". This Hotel is so close to Disney Parks, for example it is about 10min to Magic Kingdom. We watched our clothes int he coin laundry, that works well. Our son went to the heated pool and loved it. The parking is safe. The staff is very profissional but the man who received us was not friendly. His name is Davie. We loved this hotel, and come back again, certainly.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING AND SCARY!”
Reviews.Author: toryblewett
Reviews.Content: I stay here a few years ago and it was one of the scariest places I have been and I have stayed in my some bad motels. I was traveling with my mom and my three siblings...age 13-21. We got to our room that my sisters and I were staying, there was holes in the wall! Stains that looked like blood almost on the walls! A hole in the bathroom door. Stains on the floor. It was filthy and disgusting! My mom and brother said that there room was no better. I was scared to even stay at this place for one, I felt like i was in a crime scene! I would not recommend this for anyone! I cant get over how disgusting it was. As soon as we arrived we called our travel agent and unfortunately we couldnt change hotels till the next day. One night was long enough!

Reviews.Title: “You will do better at Motel 6.”
Reviews.Author: Frugalvalen
Reviews.Content: Checked in at hotel almost at 8:00 p.m., no problem. Our story of horror began the following day. Swimming pool full with individuals from don’t know where they came from. Approximately 12 people per room, the problem, they were next to us. Don’t let the pictures fouled you, this place looks like one of the projects in any neighborhood. I should take it back, the projects are more safe than this place. Lack of security, breach of security in this place enabled them to gain an F in that area. Their rugs is so nasty, unclean and unsanitary. The location is great and the staff are amicable and very courteous, even management goes above and beyond with customer to reach a good level of customer service, but, it is sad that the place is not updated to accommodate people’s demands. Needless to say, this place in the beginning was a wonderful hotel/suites to stay. It would need a major renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't do it again”
Reviews.Author: FlLuvstravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel has changed names (probably to protect the guilty!). It's now called Celebration Suites at Old Town and it's in Kissimmee. After reading the reviews I wasn't expecting much and really just wanted some space with a separate sleeping area. It was for me, my husband and and a 10 year old grandson. We were being cheap because we were spending a lot of money at Disney and didn't want to spend a lot more for lodging since we would only be sleeping there. That was a mistake. The rooms are very old, and to be honest, they have done the best they could with such old rooms. The lobby is being "remodeled" and it smelled really musty and bad. I felt sorry for the employees. The employees were nice and doing the best they could, but this is not the nicest area of town and the room was just plain creepy. It felt dirty and grungy, even though it wasn't really dirty, just old and run down. The carpet was worn and so soiled I couldn't walk on it without shoes. One bed only had a half sheet on the bottom. The furniture was decrepit and just disgusting. I felt dirty just standing in the room. When I went to the lobby the internet was down and the only people in there were all complaining about their rooms. I agree that it is a bargain for the size and price, but I didn't feel safe and I couldn't wait to leave. I didn't complain because it is what it is, and should have been torn down a long time ago. I'm not really that picky, but this room really creeped me out. Sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Great times and great friends!”
Reviews.Author: BASS4
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 and 15 other guests stayed here for a relaxing trip to the Orlando area and take in the theme parks and local entertainment. We had a great stay and the staff were very friendly and happy to accommodate our every need (extra towels, key cards, information, etc.). The rooms were spacious enough that our kids were able to run around and play with the other 7 kids. Dunkin Donuts, grocery store, restaurants, and amusement are withing very short walking distance. We visited the Disney/Universal theme parks every day and we were minutes from there via shuttle. We will be back for more fun and new friendships.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding VALUE - Huge Suites - Centralized location - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: USMC_SGT
Reviews.Content: I found this place online and booked my entire group from Texas here because of the attractive low price. Don't let the low price fool you. These suites are very clean and huge! There's a straight up full-size kitchen with a dining table, a full size fridge, and a dishwasher. I just wish I knew it was that big in the first place, I would have brought the entire family and called it a vacation. The room service was prompt, the location is ideal for pretty much anything you want to do, they had brand new mattresses, and the price is really unbeatable. They had a business center and WiFi was only $2.50/day. I will be staying here again and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - perfect for families and large groups”
Reviews.Author: aag0
Reviews.Content: We just finished a large family and friends trip to Disneyworld and stayed at the Old Town Suites (Celebration). The furnishings were perfect for our family of 4! The rooms were large and it was great to have access to a fridge and kitchen. We shopped at the Publix grocery store within walking distance to load up on water and snacks so that were fully stocked on our daily disney adventures! The kids had ample room to play with their friends as well! Disney and Universal are so close and there are daily shuttle pick-ups/drop-offs too! I recommend checking out this hotel as a way to save on lodging costs!

Reviews.Title: “Prison Camp”
Reviews.Author: Lynnep32
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th visit to the suites, on arriving I was shocked & surprised to see people keeping cats & dogs in there rooms. Whereby I asked to be moved straight away which on reflection was the worst move as unknowingly we were placed in a block where 90% of the occupants were permanent residents to which were unemployed & took great pleasure in getting drunk during the day & evening along with the recreation drugs. We even had a visit from 2 sheriiff officers in 2 cars one evening, it was so bad that my family went to the pool first thing to swim so that we didnt have to bump into the local residents.
